src: O romantismo tinha um grande elemento de determinismo cultural, extraído de escritores como Goethe, Fichte e Schlegel. A geografia, no contexto do Romantismo, fez com que os cidadãos fossem moldados e que, com o passar do tempo, surgissem os costumes e a cultura ligadas a essa geografia, que, por estar em harmonia com o lugar da sociedade, tornaram-se melhores do que as leis eventualmente obrigatórias.
mt: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, extracted from writers such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. Geography, in the context of Romanticism, made citizens be shaped and, over time, the customs and culture linked to this geography, which, being in harmony with the place of society, became better than the laws that were eventually mandatory.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Determinismo tecnológico é um termo que engloba uma série de ideias na prática, da oferta de tecnologia ou do imperativo tecnológico a uma noção estrita de que o destino humano é determinado por uma lógica subjacente associada às leis científicas e à manifestação delas na tecnologia. A maioria das interpretações do determinismo tecnológico compartilha 2 ideias gerais: a primeira, é que o próprio desenvolvimento tecnológico segue um caminho que vai além da influência cultural ou política; a segunda, é a ideia de que a tecnologia, por sua vez, tem ""efeitos"" nas sociedades que são inerentes, em vez de socialmente condicionados. Por exemplo, alguém pode falar que o automóvel necessariamente resulta no desenvolvimento de estradas. Entretanto, um rede viária nacional não é economicamente viável para apenas alguns poucos carros, então novos métodos de produção são desenvolvidos para reduzir o custo de ter um automóvel. A posse de carros em massa leva a uma incidência maior de acidentes nas estradas, o que leva à invenção de novas técnicas no sistema de saúde para curarem os corpos feridos."
mt: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a range of ideas in practice, from the offer of technology or the technological imperative to a strict notion of human destiny being determined by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: the first, is that the very development of technology follows a path that goes beyond cultural or political influence; the second, is the idea that technology, in turn, has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, someone might say that the automobile necessarily results in the development of roads. However, a national road network is not economically viable for just a few cars, so new production methods are developed to reduce the cost of having a car. The possession of cars in mass leads to a higher incidence of road accidents, which leads to the invention of new techniques in the health system to cure the injured bodies."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "A marca do ""arco apontando para cima"" tem sua aparência semelhante com um V, e a ""marca do arco apontando para baixo"" tem sua aparência semelhante com um grampo ou um quadrado sem o lado de baixo. Cima quer dizer que você deve iniciar na ponta e empurrar o arco; baixo quer dizer que você deve iniciar no talão (que é o local onde você segura o arco) e puxar o arco. Em geral um arco para cima produz um som mais suave, enquanto que um arco para baixo produz um som mais forte e assertivo. Você pode escrever suas próprias notas, mas não se esqueça de que as notas de arco impressas existem por uma razão musical, portanto, estas devem ser respeitadas."
mt: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V, and the ""down bow"" mark looks like a hook or a square without the bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow; down means you should start at the frog (which is where you hold the bow) and pull the bow. In general an up bow produces a softer sound, while a down bow produces a stronger and more assertive sound. You can write your own notes, but don't forget that printed bowing marks exist for a musical reason, so they should be respected."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Diferente de outros primatas, os hominídeos não usam mais suas mãos para locomoção, sustentação do peso, ou para se pendurar pelas árvores. A mão e o pé do chimpanzé são semelhantes em tamanho e comprimento, refletindo o uso da mão para sustentar o peso ao caminhar com os nós dos dedos. A mão humana é mais curta que o pé, com falanges mais retas. Ossos fósseis de dois milhões a três milhões de anos revelam essa alteração na especialização da mão da locomoção até a manipulação.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands for locomotion, weight support, or to hang from trees. The chimpanzee hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the use of the hand for weight support while walking on the knuckles. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with more straight phalanges. Fossil bones from two million to three million years ago reveal this alteration in the specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Pesquisa do século XX concluiu que há duas maneiras de variação genética: secreta e manifesta. A mutação adiciona uma nova variação genética e a seleção a remove do agrupamento de variação expressa. A segregação e a recombinação misturam a variação entre as duas bases com cada geração.
mt: 20th century research concluded that there are two ways of genetic variation: secret and manifest. The mutation adds a new genetic variation and the selection removes it from the group of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination mix the variation between the two bases with each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: "Na savana, é difícil para um primata com um sistema digestivo como o dos humanos, consumindo os recursos vegetais disponíveis, satisfazer suas exigências de aminoácidos. Além disso, não fazer agir de acordo gera consequências graves: depressão severa, desnutrição e, em última instância, morte. Os recursos de origem vegetal com uma maior acessibilidade seriam as proteínas em folhas e leguminosas, mas elas são difíceis para nós, primatas, digerirmos, a não ser que sejam cozidas. Entretanto, os alimentos de origem animal (formigas, cupins, ovos) não apenas são facilmente digeríveis, como também fornecem proteínas em grande quantidade que contêm todos os aminoácidos essenciais. Levando tudo isso em conta, não seria de espantar caso nossos próprios ancestrais tenham solucionado seus ""problemas de proteína"" mais ou menos como os chimpanzés da savana atuais o fazem."
mt: "In the savanna, it is difficult for a primate with a digestive system like ours, consuming the available vegetable resources, to satisfy its amino acid requirements. In addition, not acting has serious consequences: severe depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The more accessible vegetable resources would be proteins in leaves and legumes, but they are difficult for us, primates, to digest, unless they are cooked. However, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but also provide large amounts of protein containing all essential amino acids. Taking all this into account, it would not be surprising if our own ancestors solved their "protein problems" more or less as the savanna chimpanzees do."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: As subculturas reúnem indivíduos de mentalidade semelhante que se sentem negligenciados pelos padrões da sociedade e permitem que desenvolvam um senso de identidade. As subculturas podem ser distintas devido à idade, etnia, classe, localização e/ou sexo dos membros. As qualidades que determinam uma subcultura como distinta podem ser linguísticas, estéticas, religiosas, políticas, sexuais, geográficas ou uma combinação de fatores. Os membros de uma subcultura frequentemente sinalizam sua filiação por meio de um uso distinto e simbólico de estilo, que inclui modas, maneirismos e jargões.
mt: Subcultures gather individuals of similar mindset who feel neglected by society's standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures may be distinct due to the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or sex of members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their affiliation through a distinct and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and jargon.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: As crianças desenvolvem uma consciência de raça e estereótipos raciais, e esses estereótipos raciais afetam o comportamento. Por exemplo, crianças que se identificam com uma minoria racial que é estereotipada por não alcançar um bom desempenho na escola tendem a não alcançar um bom desempenho na escola quando ficam sabendo sobre o estereótipo associado à sua raça.
mt: Children develop a racial consciousness and racial stereotypes, and those racial stereotypes affect behavior. For example, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school when they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "Um dos métodos mais comuns utilizados para ilustrar a importância da socialização é recorrer aos poucos casos lamentáveis de crianças que foram, através da negligência, infortúnio, ou do abuso intencional, não socializados por adultos enquanto estavam crescendo. Essas crianças são chamadas de ""ferozes"" ou selvagens. Algumas dessas crianças foram confinadas por pessoas (normalmente pelos próprios pais); em alguns casos, o abandono dessa criança se deu à rejeição da criança por partes dos pais por causa de sua grave deficiência intelectual ou física. Crianças que são revoltadas podem ter sofrido sérios traumas ou abusos na infância, antes de serem abandonadas ou terem fugido de casa. Supõe-se que outras foram criadas por animais; dizem que algumas viveram por conta própria na selva. Quando completamente criada por animais, a criança selvagem exibe comportamentos (dentro dos limites físicos) quase inteiramente semelhantes aos do animal de estimação particular, como seu medo ou indiferença para com os humanos."
mt: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to refer to the few lamentable cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or intentional abuse, not socialized by adults while growing up. These children are called "feral" or "wild." Some of these children were confined by people (usually by their own parents); in some cases, the abandonment of this child was due to the child's rejection by the parents because of their severe intellectual or physical disability. Children who are rebellious may have suffered serious traumas or abuse in childhood, before being abandoned or having fled from home. It is supposed that others were raised by animals; it is said that some lived on their own in the jungle. When completely raised by animals, the wild child exhibits behaviors (within the physical limits) almost entirely similar to that of the particular pet animal, such as their fear or indifference towards humans."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: A agricultura de subsistência é a agricultura realizada para a produção de alimento suficiente para satisfazer apenas as necessidades dos agricultores e suas famílias. A agricultura de subsistência é um sistema simples, geralmente orgânico, que usa sementes guardadas nativas da ecorregião, combinada com a rotação de culturas ou outras técnicas relativamente simples para maximizar a produção. Historicamente, a maioria dos agricultores esteve envolvida com agricultura de subsistência, e este ainda é o caso na maioria das nações em desenvolvimento.
mt: Subsistence farming is farming done by a farmer to satisfy only the needs of his or her family. Subsistence farming is a simple, usually organic, system that uses native seeds of the ecoregion, combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize production. Historically, most farmers were involved in subsistence farming, and this is still the case in most developing nations.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: A agricultura de subsistência é a agricultura realizada para a produção de alimento suficiente para satisfazer apenas as necessidades dos agricultores e suas famílias. A agricultura de subsistência é um sistema simples, geralmente orgânico, que usa sementes guardadas nativas da ecorregião, combinada com a rotação de culturas ou outras técnicas relativamente simples para maximizar a produção. Historicamente, a maioria dos agricultores esteve envolvida com agricultura de subsistência, e este ainda é o caso na maioria das nações em desenvolvimento.
mt: Subsistence farming is farming done by a farmer to satisfy only the needs of his or her family. Subsistence farming is a simple, usually organic, system that uses native seeds of the ecoregion, combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize production. Historically, most farmers were involved in subsistence farming, and this is still the case in most developing nations.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Talvez, o tipo de turismo mais popular seja o que a grande parte das pessoas associa comviagens: turismo com o fim de lazer. E é aí que as pessoas vão para um lugar que é muito diferente do seu dia a dia para relaxar e se divertir. As praias, os parques temáticos e as áreas de acampamento são os locais mais visitados por turistas em busca de recreação. Se o objetivo de uma visita a um determinado local é conhecer a sua história e a cultura, então esse é um tipo de turismo conhecido como turismo cultural. Os turistas podem visitar diferentes pontos turísticos de um determinado país ou simplesmente optar por concentrar-se em apenas uma área.
mt: Perhaps the most popular type of tourism is the kind that most people associate with travel: leisure tourism. And it is here that people go to a place that is very different from their everyday life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camping areas are the most visited by tourists seeking recreation. If the purpose of a visit to a particular location is to learn about its history and culture, then this is a type of tourism known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different tourist attractions in a particular country or simply opt to focus on only one area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: As pessoas que se mantiveram envolvidas há várias décadas nos ajudaram a avaliar nossas qualidades e paixões, enquanto lidamos de maneira franca com as dificuldades, incluindo os fracassos. Quando ouvimos as pessoas compartilharem suas histórias individuais, familiares e organizacionais, ganhamos uma perspectiva valiosa do passado e de algumas das personalidades que influenciaram a cultura da organização para o bem e para o mal. Apesar de o entendimento da história de uma pessoa não implicar no entendimento da cultura, ao menos contribui para que as pessoas tenham uma noção de onde se enquadram na história da organização. Quando avaliam os sucessos e tornam-se cientes dos fracassos, os indivíduos e o conjunto de pessoas participantes descobrem, mais profundamente, os valores, a missão e as forças motrizes da organização. Assim sendo, rememorar casos anteriores de comportamento empreendedor e sucessos resultantes incentivou as pessoas a se permitirem novas mudanças e novos rumos para a igreja local. Tais histórias de sucesso diminuíram o medo da mudança, ao mesmo tempo, criam inclinações positivas com respeito à mudança no futuro.
mt: People who have been involved for many decades have helped us to evaluate our qualities and passions, while dealing frankly with difficulties, including failures. When we hear people share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gain a valuable perspective on the past and some of the personalities that have influenced the organization's culture for good and for ill. Although understanding a person's history does not imply understanding the culture, at least it contributes to people having a notion of where they fit in the organization's history. When they evaluate successes and become aware of failures, individuals and the group of participants discover, more deeply, the values, mission, and motivating forces of the organization. Thus, recalling past cases of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes encouraged people to allow themselves new changes and new directions for the local church. Such success stories reduced the fear of change, at the same time, creating positive inclinations with respect to change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: A abordagem pós-moderna de aprendizagem descarta uma ideia definida. Não existe apenas uma maneira de aprender. Na verdade, não há uma coisa boa somente para aprender. A aprendizagem acontece durante a experiência entre o aluno e o conhecimento apresentado. Nossa experiência atual com todos os programas de TV que ensinam coisas, como os de faça-você-mesmo e os que dão informações, ilustram esse ponto. Muitos de nós nos vemos assistindo a um programa de televisão que nos informa sobre um processo ou experiência da qual nunca participaremos ou conhecimento que nunca aplicaremos. Nós nunca reformaremos um carro, construiremos uma fonte no nosso quintal, ou viajaremos para o Peru para conhecer ruínas ancestrais, nem reformaremos a casa do nosso vizinho.
mt: Postmodern approaches to learning reject the idea of a single way to learn. There is no one good thing to learn. Learning happens during the experience between the student and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the TV programs that teach things, like do-it-yourself and those that give information, illustrate this point. Many of us find ourselves watching a TV program that informs us about a process or experience we will never participate in or knowledge we will never apply. We will never rebuild a car, build a fountain in our yard, or travel to Peru to see ancient ruins, nor will we remodel our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: A interrupção do sono é um processo que consiste em acordar propositalmente durante o período normal do sono e adormecer logo depois (10–60 minutos). Isto pode ser facilmente feito utilizando um despertador meio quieto para trazer ele à consciência sem acordá-lo de vez. Se você se vê redefinindo o relógio enquanto dorme, ele pode ser colocado do outro lado do quarto, forçando você a sair da cama para desligar ele Outras possibilidades com base no biorritmo incluem beber bastante líquido (especialmente água ou chá, um conhecido diurético) antes de dormir, pois força a pessoa a se levantar para urinar.
mt: Sleep interruption is a process that consists of waking up intentionally during the normal sleep period and falling asleep shortly afterwards (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a quiet alarm clock to bring him to consciousness without waking him up completely. If you find yourself redefining the clock while sleeping, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other possibilities based on the biorhythm include drinking a lot of liquid (especially water or tea, a well-known diuretic) before sleeping, as it forces the person to get up to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Algumas pessoas acreditam que ter vários sonhos lúcidos induzidos artificialmente muitas vezes pode ser bem exaustivo. O principal motivo para esse fenômeno é o resultado dos sonhos lúcidos, que expandem o período de tempo entre os estados REM. Ter menos sonos REM por noite, que é o estado em que você experimenta o sono de verdade e seu corpo se recupera, pode ser o suficiente para desencadear um problema de saúde. Isso é tão cansativo, quanto acordar a cada vinte ou trinta minutos e assistir TV. O efeito depende da frequência em que o seu cérebro tenta produzir sonhos lúcidos, por noite.
mt: Some people believe that having several lucid dreams induced artificially many times can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of lucid dreams, which expand the time period between REM states. Having less REM sleep per night, which is the state in which you experience real sleep and your body recovers, may be enough to trigger a health problem. This is as tiring as waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and watching TV. The effect depends on the frequency with which your brain tries to produce lucid dreams per night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: "As equipes virtuais têm que manter os mesmos padrões de excelência das equipes consideradas convencionais, no entanto, existem algumas diferenças sutis. Os membros da equipe virtual geralmente agem como o ponto de contato para seu grupo físico imediato. Eles frequentemente têm mais autonomia do que membros convencionais da equipe, pois suas equipes podem se encontrar em fusos horários variados, que podem não ser compreendidos pelas gerências locais. A presença de uma verdadeira “equipe invisível” (Larson e LaFasto, 1989, p.109) também é um componente único de uma equipe virtual. A ""equipe invisível"" é a equipe de gerenciamento para quem cada membro deve se reportar. A equipe invisível define os padrões para cada membro."
mt: "Virtual teams have to maintain the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, however, there are some subtle differences. Members of a virtual team often act as the point of contact for their immediate physical team. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members, as their teams may be in different time zones, which may not be understood by local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p.109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each member must report. The invisible team defines the standards for each member."
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Teorias de conteúdo focam em encontrar o que motiva as pessoas ou o que as atrai. Essas teorias sugerem que as pessoas possuem certas necessidades e/ou desejos que foram internalizados à medida que atingem a idade adulta. Essas teorias analisam o que há em certas pessoas que as faz querer o que elas fazem e quais coisas em seu ambiente farão com que elas façam ou não determinadas coisas. Duas teorias populares de conteúdo são a Teoria da Hierarquia de Necessidades de Maslow e a Teoria dos Dois Fatores de Herzberg.
mt: Content theories focus on finding what motivates people or what attracts them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires that have been internalized as they reach adulthood. These theories analyze what is in certain people that makes them want what they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Herzberg's Two-Factor Theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: A bastante abusada e frequentemente desmoralizada lei dos terceiros é uma diretriz bastante simples que fornece uma dinâmica ao mesmo tempo que mantém uma relativa ordem em uma figura. Segundo ele, a interseção das linhas que dividem a imagem em terços verticais e horizontais (veja o exemplo) é o lugar mais eficaz para o assunto principal.
mt: The much-abused and frequently demoralized rule of thirds is a simple guideline that provides a dynamic at the same time that it maintains a relative order in a figure. According to it, the intersection of the lines that divide the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see the example) is the most effective place for the main subject.
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Como exemplo, a forma de fotografia de imagem estática mais comum no planeta é a de 35 mm, que era o tamanho de filme que mais tinha em circulação no fim da era do filme analógico. Atualmente ainda é produzido, porém o mais importante é que sua proporção foi herdada por formatos de sensores de imagem de câmera digital. O formato em 35mm é, na verdade, de forma confusa, 36mm de largura por 24mm de altura. A proporção de tela desse formato (dividindo por doze para obter a menor razão entre números inteiros) é, portanto, de 3:2. Muitos formatos comuns (a família APS de formatos, por exemplo) são iguais ou se aproximam muito dessa proporção.
mt: As an example, the most common form of static image photography on the planet is 35 mm, which was the size of film that was most in circulation at the end of the era of analog film. It is still produced, but the most important thing is that its ratio was inherited by image sensor formats of digital camera. The 35 mm format, in fact, is, confusingly, 36 mm wide by 24 mm high. The screen ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to get the smallest ratio between integers) is therefore 3:2. Many common formats (the APS family of formats, for example) are equal or very close to this ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: A desvantagem de lentes zoom é que a complexidade focal e o número de elementos de lentes necessários para se obter alcances focais é muito maior do que para lentes fixas. Isso está se um problema menor, à medida que os fabricantes de lentes alcançam melhores padrões na produção. Isso permitiu que as lentes de ampliação criassem imagens com qualidade comparável à conseguida por lentes com distância focal fixa. Outra desvantagem das lentes zoom é que a abertura (velocidade) máxima da lente costuma ser menor. Isso faz com que lentes de zoom baratas sejam mais difíceis de usar em baixas condições de luz ambiente sem usar o flash.
mt: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and the number of lens elements required to achieve focal ranges is much greater than for fixed focal length lenses. This is less of a problem as lens manufacturers achieve better standards in production. This allowed zoom lenses to create images of comparable quality to those achieved by fixed focal length lenses. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually smaller. This makes cheap zoom lenses more difficult to use in low ambient light conditions without using the flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: A desvantagem de lentes zoom é que a complexidade focal e o número de elementos de lentes necessários para se obter alcances focais é muito maior do que para lentes fixas. Isso está se um problema menor, à medida que os fabricantes de lentes alcançam melhores padrões na produção. Isso permitiu que as lentes de ampliação criassem imagens com qualidade comparável à conseguida por lentes com distância focal fixa. Outra desvantagem das lentes zoom é que a abertura (velocidade) máxima da lente costuma ser menor. Isso faz com que lentes de zoom baratas sejam mais difíceis de usar em baixas condições de luz ambiente sem usar o flash.
mt: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and the number of lens elements required to achieve focal ranges is much greater than for fixed focal length lenses. This is less of a problem as lens manufacturers achieve better standards in production. This allowed zoom lenses to create images of comparable quality to those achieved by fixed focal length lenses. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually smaller. This makes cheap zoom lenses more difficult to use in low ambient light conditions without using the flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: O misticismo é a procura de comunhão, de identidade ou de percepção consciente da realidade última, da divindade, da verdade espiritual ou de Deus. O crente busca uma experiência, intuição ou compreensão direta sobre a realidade divina/a deidade, ou deidades. Os seguidores buscam certos estilos de vida ou práticas que visam nutrir essas experiências. O misticismo pode ser distinguido de outras formas de crença e adoração religiosas por sua ênfase na experiência pessoal direta de um estado único de consciência, particularmente aqueles de caráter pacífico, perspicaz, feliz ou mesmo extático.
mt: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion, identity or conscious perception of ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth or God. The believer seeks an experience, intuition or direct understanding of divine reality/deity, or deities. Followers seek certain styles of life or practices that aim to nourish these experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of belief and religious worship by its emphasis on personal direct experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of peaceful, perspicacious, happy or even ecstatic character.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Por um longo tempo, durante os séculos XIX e XX, acreditou-se que os primeiros habitantes da Nova Zelândia haviam sido o povo Maori, que caçava pássaros gigantes chamados moas. A teoria então estabeleceu a ideia de que o povo Maori migrou da Polinésia em uma grande frota e arrebatou a Nova Zelândia dos Moriori, estabelecendo uma sociedade agrícola. Contudo, novas evidências sugerem que os Moriori eram um grupo de Maori do continente que migraram da Nova Zelândia para as Ilhas Chatham, desenvolvendo a própria cultura distinta e pacífica. Havia outra tribo nas Ilhas Chatham, eram maoris que migraram da Nova Zelândia. Eles se chamavam de Moriori, houve alguns confrontos e no final, os Moriori foram aniquilados.
mt: For a long time, during the 19th and 20th centuries, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a large fleet and seized New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of Maori from the continent who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinct and peaceful culture. There was another tribe in the Chatham Islands, they were Maoris who migrated from New Zealand. They were called Moriori, there were some clashes and in the end, the Moriori were annihilated.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: O Origami Pureland é um método de origami em que deve-se fazer apenas uma dobra por vez. Além disso, dobras mais complexas, como dobras reversas são proibidas e todas as dobras têm localizações diretas. Foi desenvolvido por John Smith na década de 1970 para ajudar pastas inexperientes ou pessoas com habilidades motoras limitadas.
mt: The Pureland Origami is a method of origami in which one must only make one fold at a time. In addition, more complex folds, such as reverse folds are forbidden and all folds have direct locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help novice folders or people with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: A Civilização do Vale do Indo foi uma civilização da Era de Bronze no noroeste do subcontinente indiano, abrangendo a maior parte do que hoje é o Paquistão e algumas regiões no noroeste da Índia e no nordeste do Afeganistão. A civilização floresceu nas bacias do rio Indo, por isso o nome. Por mais que alguns estudiosos especulam que, como a civilização também existia nas bacias do então rio Sarasvati, o correto seria chamá-la de civilização Indo-Sarasvati, enquanto alguns a chamam de civilização Harappiana, devido a Harappa, o primeiro dos sítios a ser escavado nos anos 1920.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in the northwestern part of the Indian subcontinent, dating from the aceramic Neolithic period to the late Harappan period. It flourished in the basins of the Indus River, which flows through the Punjab region of Pakistan into India, hence the name Indus Valley Civilization. Although it is sometimes called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, because the Sarasvati River is mentioned in the Rigveda, and is thought to have been a tributary of the Indus, some scholars prefer to call it the Harappan Civilization, after the first of its sites to be excavated, Harappa.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: A ganância e o egoísmo sempre estarão presentes, e é da natureza da cooperação que, quando a maioria se beneficia, sempre tem mais a ganhar no curto prazo agindo de forma egoísta Esperamos que a maioria das pessoas perceba que sua melhor opção de longo prazo é trabalhar em harmonia com outros.
mt: Greed and selfishness will always be present, and it is the nature of cooperation that, when the majority benefits, there is always more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly. We hope that most people will realize that their best long-term option is to work in harmony with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Os gastos de guerra do imperialismo dos Estados Unidos na conquista das Filipinas foram pagos pela própria população filipina. Eles foram obrigados a pagar impostos para o regime colonial dos EUA para custear uma grande parte das despesas e dos juros de títulos com taxas flutuantes em nome do governo filipino através das casas bancárias de Wall Street. É claro que os superlucros originados da exploração prolongada do povo filipino constituiria os ganhos básicos do imperialismo norte-americano.
mt: The war expenses of the United States imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid by the Filipino people themselves. They were forced to pay taxes to the colonial regime of the US to cover a large part of the expenses and the interest of bonds with floating rates in the name of the Filipino government through the Wall Street banks. Of course, the super profits derived from the prolonged exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of the North American imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Para compreender os Templários, é necessário compreender o contexto que levou à criação da ordem. A época em que tais eventos ocorreram é comumente denominada Alta Idade Média, período da história europeia entre os séculos XI, XII e XIII (1000–1300 d.C.). A Alta Idade Média foi precedida pela Baixa Idade Média e seguida pela Tardia Idade Média, que, por convenção, termina por volta de 1500.
mt: To understand the Templars, it is necessary to understand the context that led to the creation of the order. The period in which such events occurred is commonly referred to as the High Middle Ages, a period of European history between the eleventh, twelfth and thirteenth centuries (1000–1300 AD). The High Middle Ages was preceded by the Low Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which, by convention, ends around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: A tendência militarista do Império Romano auxiliou no desenvolvimento de avanços na medicina. Os doutores começaram a ser recrutados pelo imperador Augusto e até formaram o primeiro Corpo Médico Romano para uso após as batalhas. Os cirurgiões tinham conhecimento de diversos sedativos, incluindo a morfina, extraída da papoula, e a escopolamina, extraída de sementes de plantas. Eles se tornaram profissionais em amputação para salvar pacientes de gangrena, bem como torniquetes e pinças arteriais para controlar o fluxo sanguíneo. Ao longo de muitos séculos, o Império Romano chegou a grandes avanços no campo da medicina e formou as bases de grande parte do conhecimento que temos hoje.
mt: The military trend of the Roman Empire helped the development of advances in medicine. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use after battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives, including morphine, extracted from poppies, and scopolamine, extracted from seeds of plants. They became professionals in amputation to save patients from gangrene, as well as tourniquets and arterial forceps to control blood flow. Over many centuries, the Roman Empire reached great advances in the field of medicine and formed the basis of much of the knowledge we have today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: A visão, ou a capacidade que nos permite enxergar, depende dos órgãos sensoriais do nosso sistema visual, ou dos  olhos. Existem muitas construções diferentes de olhos, variando em complexidade dependendo das exigências do organismo. As diferentes construções têm diferentes capacidades, são sensíveis a comprimentos de onda diferentes e possuem diferentes níveis de acuidade, além disso, elas necessitam de um processamento diferente para dar sentido à entrada e diferentes números para funcionar de forma otimizada.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see, depends on the sensory organs of our visual system, or the eyes. There are many different eye constructions, varying in complexity depending on the organism's requirements. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wavelengths and have different levels of acuity, in addition, they need different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "O Sikhismo é uma religião do subcontinente indiano. Ela surgiu na região de Punjab durante o século 15, oriunda de uma divisão sectária dentro da tradição hindu. Os Sikhs consideram que sua fé é uma religião distinta do hinduísmo, apesar de reconhecerem suas raízes e tradições hindus. Os Sikhs chamam sua religião de Gurmat, que significa ""o caminho do guru"" em punjabi. O guru é um aspecto fundamental de todas as religiões indianas, mas, no Sikhismo, ele assumiu uma importância que forma o núcleo das crenças Sikh. A religião foi fundada no séc. XV pelo Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Nove gurus o sucederam desde então."
mt: "Sikhism is a religion of the Indian subcontinent. It emerged in the Punjab region during the 15th century, originating from a sectary division within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a distinct religion from Hinduism, although they recognize its roots and Hindu traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which means "the way of the guru" in Punjabi. The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions, but in Sikhism, it assumed an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Nine gurus succeeded him since then."
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "O Transtorno de Déficit de Atenção ""é uma síndrome cerebral cuja tríade de definição clássica de sintomas inclui impulsividade, distração e hiperatividade ou excesso de energia"". Não é uma deficiência, é um transtorno de aprendizagem; ele ""afeta de 3% a 5% de todas as crianças, totalizando talvez 2 milhões de crianças americanas"". As crianças com DDA têm dificuldade para focar em coisas como trabalho escolar, mas conseguem se concentrar em coisas que gostam de fazer, como jogar, assistir a seus desenhos animados favoritos ou escrever frases sem pontuação. Essas crianças tendem a ter muitos problemas, porque ""se envolvem em comportamentos de risco, em brigas e desafiam a autoridade"" para estimular seu cérebro, que não pode ser estimulado por métodos normais. O DDA afeta os relacionamentos com os outros colegas porque as outras crianças não conseguem entender o motivo de se comportarem da maneira que se comportam ou o motivo de soletrarem da maneira que soletram ou que o seu nível de maturidade é diferente."
mt: "ADHD is a brain syndrome whose classical triad of defining symptoms includes impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy." It is not a deficiency, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3% to 5% of all children, totaling perhaps 2 million American children." Children with ADHD have difficulty focusing on things like schoolwork, but can focus on things they like to do, like playing, watching their favorite cartoons, or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to have many problems, because "they engage in risky behaviors, fights and defy authority" to stimulate their brain, which cannot be stimulated by normal methods. ADHD affects relationships with other children because the other children cannot understand the reason for their behavior or the reason for their spelling or that their level of maturity is different.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Embora a aprendizagem baseada em projetos torne a aprendizagem mais fácil e interessante, o método de andaime vai um passo além. O scaffolding não é um método de aprendizado, mas sim uma ajuda para alunos que estão passando por uma nova experiência de aprendizado, como usar um novo computador ou começar um novo projeto. Os scaffolds podem ser virtuais ou presenciais, em outras palavras, um professor pode ser considerado um scaffold, assim como aquele clipezinho falante do Microsoft Office. Os andaimes virtuais estão internalizados no software com o objetivo questionar, alertar e explicar procedimentos que podem ser desafiadores para o aluno lidar sozinho.
mt: While project-based learning makes learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding takes it a step further. Scaffolding is not a method of learning, but rather a help for students who are going through a new learning experience, such as using a new computer or starting a new project. Scaffolds can be virtual or physical, in other words, a teacher can be considered a scaffold, as well as that little voice in Microsoft Office. Virtual scaffolds are internalized in the software with the goal of questioning, alerting and explaining procedures that may be challenging for the student to handle alone.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: O MySpace é o terceiro site mais popular usado nos Estados Unidos e tem 54 milhões de perfis atualmente. Esses sites têm recebido bastante atenção, especialmente no ambiente educacional. Existem aspectos positivos nestes websites, os quais incluem a capacidade de se criar uma página de aulas contendo blogs, vídeos, fotos e outros recursos. Essa página pode ser acessada de forma prática, sendo necessário apenas fornecer um endereço da web, o que torna seu acesso fácil para alunos que talvez tenham problemas com ortografia ou uso do teclado. É possível a personalização para facilitar a leitura, com muita ou pouca cor, conforme desejado.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular site used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These sites have received a lot of attention, especially in the educational environment. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include the ability to create a class page containing blogs, videos, photos and other resources. This page can be accessed easily, requiring only a web address, which makes it easy for students who may have problems with spelling or keyboard use. It is possible to customize to facilitate reading, with much or little color, as desired.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Porém, em junho de 1956, as promessas de Krushchev foram colocadas à prova quando rebeldes na Polônia, onde os trabalhadores estavam protestando contra a escassez de alimentos e cortes no salário, se transformaram em um protesto geral contra o comunismo. Apesar que no fim, Krushchev tenha enviado tanques para restaurar a ordem, ele cedeu a algumas exigências econômicas e concordou em nomear o benquisto Wladyslaw Gomulka como novo primeiro-ministro.
mt: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when rebels in Poland, where workers were protesting food shortages and pay cuts, turned into a general protest against communism. Despite that in the end, Krushchev sent tanks to restore order, he conceded to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: A Alemanha era um vilão comum na Segunda Guerra Mundial, o que levou à cooperação entre a URSS e os EUA. Com o fim da guerra, os choques de sistema, processos e culturas levaram à desintegração dos países. Dois anos após o fim da guerra, os ex-aliados eram agora inimigos, e a Guerra Fria começou. O objetivo era durar pelos próximos 40 anos e, de fato, haveria liderança de tropas de reposição nos campos de batalha da África à Ásia, Afeganistão, Cuba e muitos outros lugares.
mt: Germany was a common villain in World War II, which led to cooperation between the USSR and the US. With the end of the war, system shocks, processes and cultures led to the disintegration of the countries. Two years after the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies, and the Cold War began. The goal was to last for the next 40 years, and indeed there would be troop replacements in the battlefields of Africa to Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: O Sistema Nervoso mantém a homeostase ao mandar impulsos nervosos pelo corpo para manter o fluxo de sangue seguindo inalterado. Tais impulsos nervosos podem ser enviados de forma bastante rápida pelo corpo inteiro, o que o ajuda a se manter protegido de qualquer potencial ameaça.
mt: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses throughout the body to keep the blood flow unaltered. Such nerve impulses can be sent quite quickly throughout the entire body, which helps it to stay protected from any potential threat.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: "A Grande Pirâmide de Gizé é a única das sete maravilhas do mundo que ainda existe nos dias de hoje. Construída pelos egípcios no século 3 A.C., a Grande Pirâmide é uma das muitas grandes estruturas de pirâmide construídas para honrar faraós mortos. O Platô de Gizé, ou a ""Necrópole de Gizé"", no Vale dos Mortos egípcio, conta com diversas pirâmides (dentre as quais a Grande Pirâmide é a de maior tamanho), diversas tumbas pequenas, diversos templos e a grande Esfinge. A grande pirâmide foi criada em homenagem ao Faraó Khufu, e muitas das pirâmides, tumbas e templos menores foram construídos para homenagear as esposas e familiares de Khufu."
mt: "The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only one of the seven wonders of the world that still exists today. Built by the Egyptians in the 3rd century BC, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead pharaohs. The Giza Plateau, or the "Necropolis of Giza", in the Egyptian Valley of the Kings, has several pyramids (of which the Great Pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples and the Great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created in honor of Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family."
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: O Templo de Ártemis em Éfeso foi destruído em 21 de julho de 356 a.C. em um incêndio criminoso causado por Heróstrato. Segundo a história, sua motivação era a fama, a qualquer custo. Os efésios, revoltados, declararam que o nome de Heróstrato nunca seria gravado. O historiador da Grécia Estrabão citou mais tarde o nome, que é como o conhecemos hoje. O templo teve sua destruição exatamente na mesma noite em que Alexandre o Grande teve seu nascimento. Alexandre, como rei, ofereceu-se para pagar pela reconstrução do templo, porém sua proposta foi recusada. Mais tarde, depois da morte de Alexandre, o templo foi reconstruído em 323 AC.
mt: The Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BC in a criminal fire caused by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame, at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, declared that the name of Herostratus would never be written. The historian of Greece Strabo later cited the name, which is how we know it today. The temple had its destruction exactly on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay for the reconstruction of the temple, but his proposal was rejected. Later, after the death of Alexander, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: "O primeiro meio de transporte conhecido foi a caminhada. Os humanos começaram a andar eretos há dois milhões de anos, com o surgimento do Homo Erectus (que significa ""homem ereto""). Seu antecessor, o Australopiteco, não andava ereto como de costume. As adaptações de bipedalidade são encontradas nos fósseis de Australopithecus que datam entre 4,2 e 3,9 milhões de anos atrás. No entanto, o Sahelanthropus talvez tenha andado em pé, com as duas pernas, muito antes, há sete milhões de anos."
mt: "The first known means of transportation was walking. Humans began to walk upright two million years ago, with the emergence of Homo Erectus (which means "upright man"). Its predecessor, the Australopithecus, did not walk upright as usual. Bipedal adaptations are found in the fossils of Australopithecus dating between 4.2 and 3.9 million years ago. However, Sahelanthropus may have walked upright, with both legs, much earlier, seven million years ago."
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: O uso de navios para transportar mercadorias é de longe o meio mais eficiente para movimentar pessoas e bens em larga escala pelos oceanos. O trabalho das Marinhas têm sido tradicionalmente assegurar que seu país mantenha a capacidade de deslocar população e bens enquanto, ao mesmo tempo, interferem na capacidade de seus inimigos moverem seu próprio povo  e bens. Um dos exemplos recentes mais notáveis disso foi a batalha do Atlântico Norte da Segunda Guerra Mundial. Os americanos estavam tentando deslocar homens e materiais pelo oceano Atlântico para ajudar a Grã-Bretanha. Nesse mesmo momento, a organização da marinha da Alemanha, utilizando sobretudo U-boats, estava tentando acabar com esse tráfego. Se os Aliados tivessem falhado, a Alemanha provavelmente teria a capacidade de conquistar a Grã-Bretanha como fez com o resto da Europa.
mt: The use of ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move people and goods on a large scale across the oceans. The work of navies has traditionally been to ensure that their country maintains the ability to move its population and goods while, at the same time, interfering with their enemies' ability to move their own people and goods. One of the most notable recent examples of this was the Battle of the Atlantic during World War II. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help the British. At the same time, the German navy organization, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. If the Allies had failed, Germany would probably have had the ability to conquer Britain as it did the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: A invenção das rodas com raios tornaram as carruagens assírias mais leves, mais rápidas e melhor preparadas para ultrapassar soldados e outras carruagens. As flechas de seus arcos mortíferos podiam penetrar a armadura dos soldados rivais. Por volta do ano 1000 a.C., os assírios introduziram as primeiras cavalarias. A cavalaria é um exército que luta a cavalo. A sela ainda não havia sido inventada, então o exército assírio, para lutar, cavalgava diretamente em cima das costas de seus cavalos.
mt: The invention of spoked wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. The arrows from their deadly bows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. By about 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. Cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian army, to fight, rode directly on top of the backs of their horses.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Os babilônios fizeram um templo primário para cada um de seus deuses, que eram considerado a casa de seus respectivos deus. As pessoas levavam sacrifícios aos deuses, e os sacerdotes procuravam atender às necessidades desses deuses por meio de cerimônias e festivais. Cada templo tinha um pátio aberto e um santuário interno em que apenas os sacerdotes podiam entrar. Às vezes, pirâmides especiais com formato de torres, chamadas zigurates, eram construídas para fazerem parte dos templos. O topo da torre era um santuário especial para o deus.
mt: The Babylonians built a primary temple for each of their gods, which were considered the house of their respective god. People brought sacrifices to the gods, and the priests sought to meet the needs of these gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open courtyard and an inner sanctuary in which only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramidal-shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be part of the temples. The top of the tower was a special sanctuary for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: "Sim! O Rei Tutancâmon, às vezes chamado de ""Rei Tut"" ou ""Jovem Faraó"", é um dos mais conhecidos reis do Antigo Egito nos tempos modernos. Interessantemente, ele não era considerado muito importante nos tempos antigos e não estava registrado na maioria das listas de reis antigos. Contudo, a descoberta de sua tumba em 1922 o transformou em uma celebridade. Embora muitas tumbas do passado tenham sido roubadas, esta foi deixada praticamente intacta. A maioria dos itens enterrados com Tutancâmon estavam bem preservados, incluindo milhares de artefatos feitos de metais preciosos e pedras raras."
mt: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes called ""King Tut"" or ""Young Pharaoh"", is one of the most well-known kings of Ancient Egypt in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not recorded in most lists of ancient kings. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. Although many tombs of the past have been robbed, this one was left practically intact. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun were well preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metals and rare stones."
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."
