src: Conhecemos muitos políticos, cientistas e artistas gregos. Provavelmente, a figura mais conhecida dessa cultura é Homero, o lendário poeta cego que compôs duas obras primas da literatura grega: os poemas Ilíada e a Odisseia. Sófocles e Aristófanes ainda são dramaturgos populares, e suas peças são consideradas alguns dos melhores trabalhos da literatura mundial. Outro grego célebre é o matemático Pitágoras, conhecido principalmente por seu famoso teorema sobre as relações entre os lados dos triângulos retângulos.
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists and artists. Probably the most famous figure of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights, and their plays are considered some of the best works of world literature. Another famous Greek is the mathematician Pythagoras, known mainly for his famous theorem on the relationships between the sides of right triangles.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: No clima quente do Oriente Médio, a casa não era tão importante. A maior parte da vida familiar hebraica acontecia ao ar livre. As mulheres cozinhavam no pátio, as lojas eram apenas balcões abertos de frente para a rua. Pedras eram utilizadas na construção das casas. Não havia grandes florestas na terra de Canaã, por isso, a madeira era extremamente cara.
mt: In the hot climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the Hebrew family life happened outdoors. Women cooked in the courtyard, shops were just counters facing the street. Stones were used in the construction of houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: "A Groenlândia teve sua colonização de maneira esparsa. Nas sagas nórdicas, dizem que Erik, o Vermelho, foi exilado da Islândia por assassinato e, ao viajar para o oeste, achou a Groenlândia e lhe deu esse nome. Mas, independente de sua descoberta, tribos esquimós já viviam lá na época. Embora todos os países fossem ""escandinavos"", havia muitas diferenças entre os povos, reis, costumes e história da Dinamarca, Suécia, Noruega e Islândia."
mt: "Greenland was colonized in a scattered way. In the Norse sagas, it is said that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder and, while traveling west, found Greenland and gave it that name. But, regardless of its discovery, Eskimo tribes already lived there at the time. Although all countries were "Scandinavian", there were many differences between the peoples, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland."
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Embora a maior parte de suas comidas nos fosse familiar, os romanos ainda tinham sua cota de alimentos estranhos ou incomuns, como javali, pavão, caracol e um tipo de roedor chamado arganaz Outra diferença era que, enquanto os pobres e as mulheres comiam sentados em cadeiras, os homens ricos gostavam de realizar banquetes juntos onde ficavam deitados de lado enquanto faziam suas refeições. A alimentação na Roma antiga não incluía mantimentos originados da América e da Ásia para a Europa, assim como aconteceu nos séculos posteriores. Por exemplo, eles não possuíam milho, nem tomate, nem batata, nem cacau, e nenhum antigo romano jamais provou um peru.
mt: While most of their food was familiar to us, the Romans still had their share of strange or uncommon foods, such as boar, peacock, snail and a type of rodent called aganaz Another difference was that, while the poor and women ate sitting on chairs, rich men liked to hold banquets together where they lay on their sides while making their meals. Food in ancient Rome did not include foodstuffs originating from the Americas and Asia to Europe, as happened in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, nor tomato, nor potato, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Uma civilização é uma cultura única compartilhada por um grande grupo significativo de pessoas que vivem e trabalham de forma cooperativa, uma sociedade. A palavra civilização vem do latim civilis, que significa civil, relacionado com o latim civis, que significa cidadão, e civitas, que significa cidade ou cidade-estado, e que também, de alguma forma, define o tamanho da sociedade. As cidades-estado são as precursoras das nações. A cultura da civilização depreende o repasse de conhecimento por diferentes gerações, um alcance cultural duradouro e uma justa disseminação. Culturas menores frequentemente somem sem deixar evidências históricas adequadas e não são mais reconhecidas como civilizações.
mt: A civilization is a unique culture shared by a large significant group of people who live and work cooperatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, which means civil, related to the Latin civis, which means citizen, and civitas, which means city or city-state, and which also, in some way, defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. The culture of the civilization derives the transfer of knowledge by different generations, a lasting cultural reach and a fair dissemination. Smaller cultures often disappear without leaving adequate historical evidence and are no longer recognized as civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyel Dzong é uma fortaleza que está em ruínas e um monastério budista que se encontra na parte de cima do Distrito de Paro (localizado na Vila Phondey). Diz-se que, em 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel criou a fortaleza para comemorar sua vitória contra as forças tibetanas-mongóis. No ano de 1951, um incêndio fez com que apenas algumas relíquias do Drukgyal Dzong ficassem, como a figura de Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Após o incêndio, a fortaleza foi preservada e protegida, se mantendo como uma das atrações mais extraordinárias do Butão.
mt: Drukgyel Dzong is a ruined fortress and a Buddhist monastery located at the upper part of the Paro District (located in the Village Phondey). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongolian forces. In 1951, a fire left only some relics of the Drukgyal Dzong, such as the figure of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining as one of the most extraordinary attractions of Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Durante o século XVIII, o Camboja encontrou-se comprimido entre dois vizinhos poderosos, a Tailândia e o Vietnã. Os tailandeses invadiram o Camboja várias vezes no século 18 e em 1772 destruíram Phnom Phen. Os vietnamitas também invadiram o Camboja durante os últimos anos do século XVIII.
mt: During the 18th century, Cambodia was squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 destroyed Phnom Penh. The Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia during the last years of the 18th century.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: A fundação de Taiwan remonta ao século XV, quando europeus que navegavam pela região batizaram o local como Ilha Formosa. Em 1624, a Companhia Holandesa das Índias Orientais inaugurou uma base no sudoeste de Taiwan, iniciando uma transformação nas práticas de produção de grãos aborígenes e empregando chineses para trabalhar em suas plantações de arroz e açúcar. Em 1683, as forças da dinastia Qing (1644-1912) tomaram o controle das áreas costeiras oeste e norte de Taiwan e declararam Taiwan como uma província do Império Qing em 1885. Em 1895, após a derrota na Primeira Guerra Sino-Japonesa (1894-1895), o governo Qing assina o Tratado de Shimonoseki, pelo qual cede a soberania sobre Taiwan ao Japão, que governa a ilha até 1945.
mt: The foundation of Taiwan dates back to the 15th century, when Europeans who sailed the region named the area Formosa. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in the indigenous grain production practices and employing Chinese to work in its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces took control of the island's western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it ceded sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which governed the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Isso é chamado de PH químico. Você pode fazer um marcador utilizando suco de repolho roxo. O suco de repolho muda de cor dependendo de quão ácido ou básico (alcalino) o produto químico é. O nível de pH é indicado pela quantidade de íons de hidrogênio (o H em pH) na substância química testada. Os íons de hidrogênio são prótons que tiveram seus elétrons retirados (já que os átomos de hidrogênio consistem em um próton e um elétron).
mt: This is called a pH indicator. You can make a marker using red cabbage juice. Red cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of hydrogen ions (the H in pH) in the chemical being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons that have had their electrons stripped away (since hydrogen atoms consist of a proton and an electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Leões são os felinos mais sociais, vivendo em grandes grupos chamados de alcateias. Os bandos consistem de um a três machos adultos da mesma família, junto com até 30 fêmeas e filhotes. As mulheres costumam ser intimamente relacionadas entre si, sendo uma grande família de irmãs e filhas. Alcateias de leões agem de forma similar a grupos de lobos ou cães, animais surpreendentemente similares a leões (mas não a outros grandes felinos) em comportamento, e também muito mortais às suas presas.
mt: Lions are the most social of the big cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides consist of one to three adult males of the same family, along with up to 30 females and cubs. Females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act similarly to wolf or dog packs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not to other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Abaixo deles existem os gatos de porte médio que se alimentam de presas de porte médio, desde coelhos até antílopes e veados. Por fim, existem muitos gatos pequenos (incluindo gatos de estimação soltos) que comem animais pequenos, muito mais numerosos, como insetos, roedores, lagartos e pássaros. A revelação para o sucesso deles é o conceito de nicho, uma função especial que cada gato faz que os impedem de competirem uns com os outros.
mt: Below them are the medium-sized cats that eat medium-sized prey, from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including feral house cats) that eat small animals, much more numerous, such as insects, rodents, lizards and birds. The revelation for their success is the concept of niche, a special function that each cat does that prevents them from competing with each other.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: As jaguatiricas gostam de comer animais pequenos. Elas capturam macacos, cobras, roedores e pássaros se conseguirem. Quase todos os animais que a jaguatirica caça são muito menores que ela. Cientistas acreditam que as jaguatiricas seguem e encontram suas presas pelo cheiro, farejando onde elas estiveram pelo solo. Elas podem ver muito bem no escuro com a visão noturna e também conseguem se mover de forma furtiva. As jaguatiricas caçam suas presas misturando-se com o ambiente que as rodeia e, em seguida, atacam suas presas.
mt: Jaguars like to eat small animals. They capture monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all the animals that the jaguar hunts are much smaller than it. Scientists believe that the jaguars follow and find their prey by smell, sniffing where they were by the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision and also can move stealthily. The jaguars hunt their prey by mixing with the environment that surrounds them and then attack their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Um atleta bem equilibrado, o tigre pode escalar (embora não bem), nadar, pular grandes distâncias e puxar com cinco vezes a força de um humano forte. O tigre está no mesmo grupo (Gênero Panthera) que os leões, leopardos e onças. Esses quatro felinos são os únicos que conseguem rugir. O rugido do tigre não é como o rugido a toda voz de um leão, mas mais como uma frase de palavras gritadas e rosnadas.
mt: A well-balanced athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, jump great distances and pull with five times the strength of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards and tigers. These four felines are the only ones that can roar. The roar of the tiger is not like the roar of a lion, but more like a phrase of words shouted and growled.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Uma célula é a menor unidade estrutural e funcional de um organismo (ser) vivo. Célula vem da palavra latina cella, que significa cômodo pequeno. Se você ver os seres vivos sob um microscópio, verá que são feitos de pequenos quadrados ou bolas. Robert Hooke, um biólogo da Inglaterra, viu pequenos quadrados em cortiça com um microscópio. Elas pareciam câmaras. Ele foi a primeira pessoa a observar células mortas.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism (living thing). Cell comes from the Latin word cella, which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, an English biologist, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Os animais são feitos de várias células. Eles comem coisas e as digerem em seu interior. A maior parte dos animais consegue se locomover. Apenas animais têm cérebros (embora nem todos os animais tenham; a água-viva, por exemplo, não tem cérebro). Os animais são encontrados por todo o planeta. Eles cavam o solo, nadam nos oceanos e voam pelo céu.
mt: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not all animals do; the sea anemone, for example, does not have a brain). Animals are found all over the planet. They dig the soil, swim in the oceans and fly through the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: As plantas produzem o oxigênio que os humanos respiram e absorvem dióxido de carbono que os humanos exalam (isto é, expiram) As plantas usam do sol como seu alimento por meio da fotossíntese. Eles também oferecem sombra. Construímos nossas casas usando plantas e fazemos nossas roupas usando plantas. A maior parte dos alimentos que consumimos são plantas. Sem plantas, os animais não conseguiriam sobreviver.
mt: Plants produce the oxygen that humans breathe and absorb carbon dioxide that humans exhale (that is, expel). They use the sun as their food through photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We build our houses using plants and make our clothes using plants. Most of the food we consume are plants. Without plants, animals would not be able to survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Quando um pequeno grupo de seres vivos (uma pequena população) se separa da população principal de onde vieram (por exemplo, se transpõem uma cadeia de montanhas ou um rio, ou se vão para uma ilha de onde não é possível voltar com facilidade), muitas vezes ele se vê em um ambiente diferente daquele em que habitava antes. Esse  novo ambiente tem recursos diferentes e novos competidores, então a nova população precisará adquirir características diferentes das que já possui e adaptar-se para se tornar uma forte competidora. A população original não mudou em nada, eles ainda precisam das mesmas adaptações de antes. Com o passar do tempo, conforme a nova população começa a se adaptar ao seu novo ambiente, ela vai ficando menos e menos parecida com a outra população. Eventualmente, depois de milhares ou mesmo milhões de anos, as duas populações parecerão tão diferentes que não poderão ser chamadas da mesma espécie. Chamamos esse processo de especiação, que simplesmente significa a formação de novas espécies. A especiação é uma consequência inevitável e uma parte muito importante da evolução.
mt: When a small group of living things (a small population) separates from the main population from which they came (for example, they cross a mountain range or a river, or go to an island from which it is not easy to return), they often find themselves in a different environment from the one they were in before. This new environment has different resources and new competitors, so the new population will need to acquire different characteristics from those it already has and adapt to become a strong competitor. The original population has not changed in any way, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to its new environment, it will become less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they cannot be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which simply means the formation of new species. Speciation is an inevitable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: O principal órgão do sistema circulatório é o coração, que bombeia o sangue. O sangue viaja para longe do coração em tubos que se chamam artérias e volta ao coração em tubos que se chamam veias. Os tubos menores são chamados de vasos capilares.
mt: The main organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood travels away from the heart in tubes called arteries and back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smaller tubes are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Insetos foram os primeiros animais a irem para o ar. Sua habilidade de voar os ajudou a fugir mais facilmente de inimigos e a encontrar alimento e parceiros de maneira mais eficiente. A maioria dos insetos têm a vantagem de poder dobrar suas asas ao longo do corpo. Isso lhes dá uma gama maior de pequenos locais para se esconderem de predadores. Hoje, os únicos insetos que não podem dobrar suas asas para trás são libélulas e efêmeras.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly helped them escape enemies and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings along their body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold their wings back are dragonflies and mayflies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Muitos paleontólogos hoje acreditam que um grupo de dinossauros sobreviveu e está vivo até hoje. Nós os chamamos de pássaros. Muitas pessoas não pensam neles como dinossauros porque têm penas e podem voar. Mas ainda há muitas semelhanças entre os pássaros e os dinossauros. Eles têm patas com escamas e garras, botam ovos e caminham sobre suas duas patas traseiras, como um T-rex.
mt: Many paleontologists today believe that a group of dinosaurs survived and is still alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are still many similarities between birds and dinosaurs. They have scaly feet and claws, lay eggs and walk on their two hind legs, like a T-rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Os dentes de um tricerátops provavelmente eram capazes de esmagar não só as folhas, mas também os galhos e as raízes bastante resistentes. Alguns cientistas acham que os Tricerátops comiam cicadáceas, um tipo de planta que era comum no período Cretáceo. Essas plantas têm a aparência semelhante com uma pequena palmeira com uma copa de folhas pontudas e cortantes. Um tricerátops poderia ter usado seu forte bico para arrancar as folhas antes de comer o tronco. Outros cientistas argumentam que essas plantas são muito venenosas, então é improvável que algum dinossauro as comesse, embora hoje a preguiça e outros animais como o papagaio (descendente dos dinossauros) possam comer folhas ou frutas venenosas.
mt: The teeth of a triceratops were probably able to crush not only the leaves, but also the branches and the very resistant roots. Some scientists think that the Triceratops ate cycads, a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous period. These plants look like a small palm with a crown of pointed and sharp leaves. A triceratops could have used its strong beak to tear the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, although today the sloth and other animals such as the parrot (descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruits.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: A seleção de futebol da Itália, junto com a seleção alemã, é a segunda mais bem-sucedida do mundo e foi campeã da Copa do Mundo da FIFA em 2006. Os esportes populares incluem futebol, basquete, vôlei, polo aquático, esgrima, rúgbi, ciclismo, hóquei no gelo, hóquei em patins e corridas de F1. Os esportes de inverno são mais populares nas regiões do norte, com os italianos competindo em jogos internacionais e eventos olímpicos.
mt: Italy's national football team, along with Germany's, is the second most successful in the world and was FIFA World Cup champion in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and Formula 1. Winter sports are more popular in the northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxemburgo tem uma longa história, mas sua independência data de 1839. As partes atuais da Bélgica faziam parte do Luxemburgo no passado, mas tornaram-se belgas após a Revolução Belga de 1830. Luxemburgo sempre tentou manter-se um país neutro, mas foi ocupado durante as duas Guerras Mundiais, pela Alemanha. Em 1957, Luxemburgo tornou-se membro fundador da organização que hoje é conhecida como União Europeia.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but its independence dates back to 1839. Parts of what are now Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past, but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution of 1830. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country, but was occupied during both World Wars, by Germany. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: A Turquia europeia (Trácia oriental ou Rumélia na península dos Balcãs) inclui 3% da nação. O território da Turquia é maior que 1.600 quilômetros (1.000 milhas) em comprimento e 800 km (500 milhas) em largura, além do formato semelhante ao de um retângulo O território da Turquia, incluindo os lagos, ocupa 783.562 km² (300.948 mi²); 755.688 km² (291.773 mi²) ficam no sudoeste da Ásia e 23.764 km² (9.174 mi²) ficam na Europa. O território da Turquia torna o país o 37º maior do mundo e tem o tamanho dos territórios da França Metropolitana e do Reino Unido juntos. A Turquia é cercada por mares em três lados: o Mar Egeu a oeste, o Mar Negro ao norte e o Mar Mediterrâneo ao sul.
mt: 3% of the nation is in European Turkey (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula). The territory of Turkey is larger than 1,600 kilometers (1,000 miles) in length and 800 km (500 miles) in width, in addition to the similar shape to a rectangle. The territory of Turkey, including the lakes, occupies 783,562 km² (300,948 mi²); 755,688 km² (291,773 mi²) are in southwestern Asia and 23,764 km² (9,174 mi²) are in Europe. The territory of Turkey makes the country the 37th largest in the world and has the size of the territories of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom together. Turkey is surrounded by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: A população da Cidade do Vaticano tem cerca de 800 pessoas. É o menor país independente do mundo, e com a menor população. A Cidade do Vaticano usa o italiano em suas legislações e comunicações oficiais. O italiano também é a língua comum usada pela maioria dos que trabalham no estado, enquanto o latim é frequentemente usado em cerimônias religiosas. Todos os cidadãos da cidade do Vaticano são católicos romanos.
mt: The population of the Vatican City is about 800 people. It is the smallest independent country in the world, and with the smallest population. The Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the common language used by most who work in the state, while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of the Vatican City are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Os computadores de hoje são usados para manipular fotos e vídeos. Animações sofisticadas podem ser desenvolvidas em computadores, e este tipo de animação está cada vez mais sendo usado na televisão e em filmes. Várias vezes, a música é gravada em máquinas sofisticadas para processar e combinar sons.
mt: Today's computers are used to manipulate photos and videos. Sophisticated animations can be developed on computers, and this type of animation is increasingly being used in television and movies. Music is often recorded on sophisticated machines to process and combine sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: As cidades de Harappa e Mohenjo-Daro tinham um assento sanitário com descarga em quase todas as casas, ligado a um sofisticado sistema de esgoto. Partes remanescentes de sistemas de esgoto foram encontradas nas casas das cidades minoicas de Creta e Santorini, na Grécia. Também havia sanitários no Egito Antigo, na Pérsia e na China. Na civilização romana, os sanitários às vezes eram parte das casas de banho públicas, frequentadas tanto por homens quanto por mulheres.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-Daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, connected to a sophisticated sewer system. Remains of sewer systems were found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini, Greece. There were also toilets in Ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman civilization, the toilets were sometimes part of the public bath houses, frequented by both men and women.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: A lâmina dos patins de gelo possui dois gumes com uma cavidade no meio. Eles permitem um melhor aferramento ao gelo, mesmo quando inclinados. Como a parte inferior da lâmina é ligeiramente curvada, conforme a lâmina vai se inclinando de um lado para outro, a borda que está em conato com o gelo também se curva. Isso faz com que o patinador vire. Se os patins inclinarem para a direita, o patinador vira para a direita, se os patins inclinarem para a esquerda, o patinador vira para a esquerda.
mt: The blade of the ice skates has two grooves with a cavity in the middle. They allow a better grip on the ice, even when tilted. As the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts from side to side, the edge that is in contact with the ice also curves. This makes the skater turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns to the right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Para retornar ao nível anterior de energia, seria necessário descarregar a carga extra que foi recebida da iluminação. Eles fazem isso emitindo uma pequena partícula de luz chamada ""fóton"". Os cientistas chamam esse processo de ""emissão estimulada de radiação"" pois os átomos são estimulados pela luz brilhante, provocando a emissão de um fóton de luz, e a luz é um tipo de radiação. A próxima figura mostra os átomos emitindo fótons. Claro, na realidade, fótons são muito menores que esses na foto. Os fótons são ainda menores do que as partículas que formam os átomos!"
mt: "To return to the previous level of energy, it would be necessary to discharge the extra charge that was received from the lighting. They do this by emitting a small particle of light called a "photon". Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next figure shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality, photons are much smaller than those in the picture. The photons are even smaller than the particles that form the atoms!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: "Para retornar ao nível anterior de energia, seria necessário descarregar a carga extra que foi recebida da iluminação. Eles fazem isso emitindo uma pequena partícula de luz chamada ""fóton"". Os cientistas chamam esse processo de ""emissão estimulada de radiação"" pois os átomos são estimulados pela luz brilhante, provocando a emissão de um fóton de luz, e a luz é um tipo de radiação. A próxima figura mostra os átomos emitindo fótons. Claro, na realidade, fótons são muito menores que esses na foto. Os fótons são ainda menores do que as partículas que formam os átomos!"
mt: "To return to the previous level of energy, it would be necessary to discharge the extra charge that was received from the lighting. They do this by emitting a small particle of light called a "photon". Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next figure shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality, photons are much smaller than those in the picture. The photons are even smaller than the particles that form the atoms!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Depois de centenas de horas de funcionamento, o filamento da lâmpada eventualmente queima, e a lâmpada não funciona mais. A lâmpada então precisa ser trocada. É necessário ter cuidado ao trocar a lâmpada. Primeiro, a chave da luminária deve ser desligada ou o cabo, desconectado. Isso acontece pois a eletricidade flui para o soquete, onde fica a parte metálica da lâmpada, podendo causar um forte choque elétrico, se você tocar o interior do soquete ou a base metálica da lâmpada, enquanto ela ainda está parcialmente no soquete.
mt: After hundreds of hours of operation, the filament of the bulb eventually burns out, and the bulb no longer works. The bulb then needs to be replaced. It is important to be careful when replacing the bulb. First, the light switch should be turned off or the cord, disconnected. This happens because the electricity flows to the socket, where the metal part of the bulb is, which can cause a strong electric shock, if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb, while it is still partially in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: A bomba de fissão funciona pautada no princípio de que é necessário energia para construir um núcleo com diversos prótons e nêutrons. É mais ou menos como andar com um carrinho pesado para cima de uma colina. A divisão do núcleo novamente libera, então, um pouco dessa energia. Alguns átomos têm núcleos instáveis, o que significa que tendem a se separar com pouco ou nenhum incentivo.
mt: A fission bomb works based on the principle that energy is needed to build a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. It's kind of like pushing a heavy cart up a hill. The splitting of the nucleus then releases, in turn, some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei, meaning they tend to split with little or no encouragement.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Quando você liga para alguém que está a milhares de quilômetros de distância, você está usando um satélite. O satélite no espaço recebe a chamada e depois a redireciona de volta, quase instantaneamente. O satélite foi enviado para o espaço por um foguete. Os cientistas usam telescópios no espaço porque a atmosfera da Terra distorce parte da nossa luz e visão. É necessário um foguete gigante com mais de 30 metros de altura para colocar um satélite ou telescópio no espaço.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space receives the call and then redirects it back, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere distorts some of our light and vision. It takes a giant rocket over 30 meters tall to put a satellite or telescope into space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: O tempo é algo que está ao nosso redor, e afeta tudo o que fazemos, ainda que seja difícil de entender. O tempo foi estudado por acadêmicos religiosos, filosóficos e científicos por milhares de anos. Experienciamos o tempo como uma série de eventos passando do futuro através do presente para o passado. O tempo é, também, como comparamos a duração (comprimento) de eventos. Você pode marcar a passagem do tempo por conta própria observando a repetição de um evento cíclico. Um evento cíclico é algo que acontece de novo e de novo com regularidade.
mt: Time is something that is around us, and affects everything we do, even though it is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passage of time by yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclic event. A cyclic event is something that happens over and over again with regularity.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Tradicionalmente, o herdeiro do trono iria direto para o exército depois de concluir a escola. Contudo, Charles frequentou a universidade em Trinity College, Cambridge, onde ele estudou Antropologia e Arqueologia, e depois História, ganhando um 2:2 (um diploma de segunda classe). Charles foi o primeiro membro da Família Real Britânica a obter uma graduação.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the army after finishing school. However, Charles attended university at Trinity College, Cambridge, where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and then History, earning a 2:2 (a second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to obtain a degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Após a reconquista de Danelaw, a Inglaterra havia vivido um longo período de paz. Contudo, em 991, era a maior frota viking com que Ethelred havia enfrentado desde a de Guthrum, um século antes. Essa frota era guiada por Olaf Trygvasson, um norueguês com vontade de recuperar seu país da força dinamarquesa. Depois de contratempos militares iniciais, foi possível que Ethelred chegasse a um acordo com Olaf, que retornou à Noruega para tentar ganhar seu reino, com certo sucesso.
mt: After the reconquest of Danelaw, England had lived a long period of peace. However, in 991, it was the largest Viking fleet that Ethelred had faced since Guthrum's, a century before. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with a will to recover his country from the Danish force. After initial military setbacks, it was possible that Ethelred reached an agreement with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to win his kingdom, with some success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Por volta do século XV, o norte da Estônia estava sobre grande influência cultural alemã. Alguns monges alemães queriam aproximar Deus do povo nativo, então inventaram a idioma literal estoniano. Era baseado no alfabeto alemão e um caractere ""Õ/õ"" foi adicionado. Conforme o tempo passou, muitas palavras de origem alemã foram assimiladas. Isso foi o começo do iluminismo."
mt: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence from Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the literal Estonian language. It was based on the German alphabet and a character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words of German origin were assimilated. This was the beginning of the Enlightenment."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Existem várias estimativas para o número de pessoas que falam o idioma hindi. Estima-se que seja entre a segunda e a quarta língua mais falada no mundo. O número de falantes nativos varia dependendo se os dialetos intimamente relacionados sejam contados ou não. As estimativas variam entre 340 milhões e 500 milhões de falantes e até 800 milhões de pessoas podem entender o idioma. Hindi e urdu são semelhantes no vocabulário, mas diferentes na escrita; em conversas cotidianas, os falantes de ambos os idiomas normalmente conseguem entender uns aos outros.
mt: There are several estimates for the number of people who speak the Hindi language. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether closely related dialects are counted or not. Estimates vary between 340 million and 500 million speakers and up to 800 million people may understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary, but different in writing; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "Hangeul é o único alfabeto inventado de propósito de uso diário popular. O alfabeto foi inventado em 1444 durante o reinado do Rei Sejong (1418 - 1450). O rei Sejongue foi o quarto rei da Dinastia Joseon e é um dos mais estimados. Ele chamou originalmente o alfabeto Hangeul de Hunmin Jeongeum, que significa ""os sons corretos para a instrução do povo""."
mt: "Hangeul is the only alphabet invented for everyday popular use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 - 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most revered. He originally called the alphabet Hangeul Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people."""
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Existem muitas teorias sobre como o Sânscrito veio a existir. Uma delas é sobre uma migração ariana do oeste para a Índia que levou sua linguagem com eles. O sânscrito é uma língua antiga comparável ao Latim que era falado na Europa. O livro mais antigo de que se tem conhecimento foi escrito em sânscrito. Após a compilação dos Upanixades, o sânscrito perdeu a importância na hierarquia. O sânscrito é uma língua rica e complexa, que serviu de base para muitas línguas modernas da Índia, assim como o Latim é a base para línguas europeias como o francês e o espanhol.
mt: There are many theories about how Sanskrit came to exist. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west to India that brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language comparable to Latin that was spoken in Europe. The oldest book known to exist was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of the Upanishads, Sanskrit lost importance in the hierarchy. Sanskrit is a rich and complex language that served as a base for many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the base for European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Como a gravidade de lo afetar-me-ia? Se você estivesse na superfície de lo, teria um peso menor do que na Terra. Uma pessoa cujo peso é de 200 libras (90 kg) no planeta Terra iria pesar cerca de 16 kg em Io. Conclui-se então que a gravidade o atrai menos.
mt: How would gravity affect me? If you were on the surface of Io, you would have a lower weight than on Earth. A person whose weight is 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 16 kg on Io. It is concluded that gravity pulls you less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: A superfície da Lua é composta de pedras e poeira. A camada externa da Lua é chamada de crosta. A crosta possui 70 km de espessura no lado visível e 100 km de espessura no lado invisível. A camada é mais fina debaixo dos mares e mais espessa abaixo das montanhas. Pode haver mais maria no lado mais próximo porque a crosta é mais fina. Era mais fácil para a lava subir para a superfície.
mt: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust has 70 km of thickness on the visible side and 100 km of thickness on the invisible side. The layer is thinner under the seas and thicker under the mountains. There may be more seas on the closer side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for the lava to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Muitas pessoas sonham com o dia em que os humanos poderão viajar para outra estrela e explorar outros mundos, algumas se perguntam o que existe lá fora, algumas acreditam que alienígenas ou outras formas de vida podem viver em outro planeta. Mas, se isso um dia acontecer, provavelmente não acontecerá por muito tempo. As estrelas estão tão espalhadas que há trilhões de quilômetros entre estrelas que são ""vizinhas"". Um dia, talvez, os seus bisnetos estarão num planeta extraterrestre, perguntando-se sobre os ancestrais arcaicos deles?"
mt: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some wonder what is out there, some believe that aliens or other forms of life may live on another planet. But if this ever happens, it will not happen for very long. Stars are so spread out that there are trillions of kilometers between stars that are ""neighbors"". One day, perhaps, your great-grandchildren will be on an extraterrestrial planet, wondering about their ancient ancestors?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "O Sol não tem uma crosta como a da Terra, onde as pessoas podem viver. O Sol é totalmente composto por gases, fogo e plasma. O gás se torna mais fino à medida que você fica mais longe do centro do Sol. A parte externa que nós vemos ao olhar para o Sol é chamada de fotosfera, que significa ""bola de luz""."
mt: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth's, where people can live. The Sun is entirely composed of gases, fire and plasma. Gas becomes thinner as you get further away from the Sun's center. The outer part that we see when looking at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light."""
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Cerca de três mil anos depois, em 1610, o astrônomo italiano Galileo Galilei utilizou um telescópio para observar que Vênus, assim como a lua, tem fases. As fases acontecem porque apenas o lado de Vênus (ou da Lua) voltado para o Sol é iluminado. As fases de Vênus sustentavam a teoria de Copérnico de que os planetas giram em torno do sol. Então, alguns anos depois, em 1639, um astrônomo inglês chamado Jeremiah Horrocks observou um trânsito de Vênus.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus, like the moon, has phases. The phases happen because only the side of Venus (or the Moon) facing the Sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported Copernicus' theory that the planets revolve around the Sun. Then, a few years later, in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: O Amazonas é o maior rio e o segundo mais longo da Terra. Ele carrega mais de oito vezes mais água do que o segundo maior rio. O Amazonas também é o rio mais largo da Terra, às vezes com quase 10 km de largura. Um total de 20% da água que vão dos rios do planeta para os oceanos vem da Amazônia. O principal Rio Amazonas possui 6.387 km (3.980 milhas). Ele recebe água de milhares de rios menores.
mt: The Amazon is the largest river and the second longest river in the world. It carries more than eight times as much water as the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river in the world, sometimes with almost 10 km (6 miles) wide. A total of 20% of the water that goes from rivers on the planet to the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River has 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It receives water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Dezoito por cento dos venezuelanos estão desempregados, e a maioria daqueles que tem emprego trabalham na economia informal. Dois terços dos venezuelanos que trabalham são do setor de serviços, quase um quarto na indústria e um quinto na agricultura. Uma importante indústria para os venezuelanos é a de petróleo, onde o país é um exportador líquido, mesmo que somente um por cento trabalhe na indústria petrolífera.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who have jobs work in the informal economy. Two-thirds of Venezuelans who work are in the service sector, nearly a quarter in industry and one-fifth in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: As estrelas emitem luz e calor devido à combinação (ou fusão) de energia produzida entre os átomos de hidrogênio, formando assim elementos mais pesados. Os cientistas estão trabalhando para criar um reator que produz energia da mesma forma. Este, no entanto, é um problema muito difícil de resolver e levará muitos anos antes que vejamos a construção de reatores de fusão úteis.
mt: Stars emit light and heat due to the combination (or fusion) of energy produced between the atoms of hydrogen, thus forming heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that produces energy in the same way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve and it will take many years before we see the construction of useful fusion reactors.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elementos e compostos podem alternar de estados sem sofrer alterações. O nitrogênio como gás ainda tem as mesmas propriedades do nitrogênio líquido. O estado líquido é mais denso, mas as moléculas ainda são as mesmas. A água é outro exemplo. O composto água é feito de dois átomos de hidrogênio e um átomo de oxigênio. Tem a mesma estrutura molecular, seja um gás, líquido ou sólido. Apesar de que seu estado físico possa mudar, seu estado químico permanece o mesmo.
mt: Elements and compounds can change states without changing. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties of liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser, but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The water compound is made of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure, whether it is a gas, liquid or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Durante a Guerra Revolucionária, os treze estados primeiro formaram um governo central fraco — sendo o Congresso seu único componente — conforme os Artigos da Confederação. Faltava poder ao Congresso para exigir tributos, e em razão de não existir executivo ou judiciário nacional, confiava nas autoridades estaduais, que geralmente não cooperavam, para aplicar todas as suas leis. Além disso, não existia autoridade para revogar as leis fiscais e tarifas entre os estados. Os Artigos necessitavam do consentimento unânime entre todos os estados antes que pudessem ser emendados e os estados deram tão pouca importância ao governo central que os representantes deles quase nunca estavam presentes.
mt: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government — the Congress being its only component — under the Articles of Confederation. The Congress lacked power to levy taxes, and lacking executive and judicial branches, relied on state authorities, which usually did not cooperate, to enforce all its laws. Moreover, there was no authority to repeal state fiscal laws and tariffs. The Articles required unanimous consent among all states before they could be amended, and the states gave so little importance to the central government that their representatives were almost never present.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "Se você já viu o filme A Lenda do Tesouro Perdido, você pode achar que um mapa do tesouro foi desenhado na parte de trás da Declaração de Independência. No entanto, isso não é verdade. Embora haja algo escrito no verso do documento, não é um mapa do tesouro. Escritas no verso da Declaração de Independência estão as palavras ""Declaração de Independência Original, datada de 4 de julho de 1776"". O texto aparece no canto inferior do documento, de cabeça para baixo. Embora ninguém saiba ao certo quem a escreveu, é sabido que, no início de sua existência, o grande documento de pergaminho (ele mede 29¾ polegadas por 24½ polegadas) foi enrolado para ser armazenado. Desse modo, é provável que uma nota foi simplesmente adicionada como rótulo."
mt: "If you've seen the movie The Goonies, you may think that a treasure map was drawn on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, this is not true. Although something is written on the back of the Declaration of Independence, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence are the words ""Original Declaration of Independence, dated 4 July, 1776"". The text appears in the lower corner of the document, upside down. Although no one knows for sure who wrote it, it is known that, in its early existence, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. Thus, it is likely that a note was simply added as a label."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: No início da independência da nação, a experiência do Jardim Botânico de Cingapura ajudou a transformar a ilha em uma cidade-jardim tropical. No ano de 1981, a Vanda Miss Joaquim, uma híbrida de orquídea, foi eleita como a flor nacional do país.
mt: At the start of the nation's independence, the experience of Singapore Botanic Gardens helped transform the island into a tropical garden city. In 1981, the Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was elected as the country's national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Apesar de que a construção de pirâmides de pedra tenha continuado até o fim do Império Antigo, as pirâmides de Gizé nunca foram superadas em tamanho e em excelência técnica de construção. Os antigos do Egito do Novo Império se maravilhavam com as construções de seus antecessores, que tinham até então muito mais de mil anos.
mt: Despite the construction of stone pyramids continuing until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in size and in technical excellence of construction. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom marveled at the constructions of their predecessors, which had then over a thousand years.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Todo os anos, por volta de outubro, quase 1,5 milhão de herbívoros viajam em direção às planícies do sul, cruzando o Rio Mara, vindo das colinas do norte, em busca das chuvas. Em seguida, de volta ao norte pelo oeste, atravessando outra vez o rio Mara, depois das chuvas de abril. A região de Serengeti conta com o Parque Nacional do Serengeti, com a Área de Conservação de Ngorongoro, com a Reserva de Caça Maswa no país da Tanzânia e com a Reserva Nacional Maasai Mara no país da Quênia.
mt: Every year, around October, almost 1.5 million herbivores travel southwards, crossing the Mara River, coming from the hills of the north, in search of the rains. Then, back to the north by the west, crossing the river again, after the rains of April. The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, the Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

Em seguida, de volta ao norte pelo oeste, atravessando outra vez o rio Mara, depois das chuvas de abril. src: "Com o fim da batalha pela França, a Alemanha começou a preparar-se para invadir a Grã-Bretanha. A Alemanha se referiu ao ataque como “Operação Sealion”. Grande parte das armas pesadas e dos suprimentos do Exército Britânico foram dados como perdidos quando eles precisaram evacuar de Dunquerque, por isso o exército estava bem fraco. Mas a Marinha Real ainda era muito mais poderosa que a Marinha alemã (""Kriegsmarine"") e poderia destruir qualquer frota que fosse enviada para invadir o Canal da Mancha. No entanto, pouquíssimos navios da Marinha Real estavam atracados perto das prováveis rotas de invasão, pois os almirantes temiam que fossem afundados por um ataque aéreo alemão."
mt: "With the end of the battle for France, Germany began to prepare to invade Britain. Germany referred to the attack as "Operation Sealion". Most of the heavy weapons and supplies of the British Army were given up as lost when they had to evacuate from Dunkirk, so the army was very weak. But the Royal Navy was still much more powerful than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could destroy any fleet that was sent to invade the English Channel. However, very few ships of the Royal Navy were moored near the likely invasion routes, as the admirals feared they would be sunk by a German air attack."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
