src: "Vamos começar com uma explanação sobre os planos da Itália. A Itália era principalmente a ""irmã caçula"" da Alemanha e do Japão. Apesar de terem construído quatro novos navios pouco antes do início da guerra, tinham um exército e uma marinha mais fracos. Os principais objetivos da Itália eram os países africanos. Para capturá-los, eles precisariam ter uma plataforma de lançamento de tropas, de modo que pudessem cruzar o Mar Mediterrâneo e invadir a África. Por isso, eles precisaram sumir com as bases e os navios britânicos no Egito. Além dessas ações, os navios de guerra italianos não deveriam fazer nada mais. Agora ao Japão. O Japão era um país insular, assim como o Reino Unido."
mt: "Let's start with an explanation of Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "younger sister" of Germany and Japan. Despite having built four new ships just before the start of the war, they had a weaker army and navy. Italy's main objectives were the African countries. To capture them, they needed a troop launching platform, so they could cross the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For this reason, they needed to sink the British bases and ships in Egypt. Apart from these actions, Italian warships should do nothing more. Now to Japan. Japan was an island country, just like the United Kingdom."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "Vamos começar com uma explanação sobre os planos da Itália. A Itália era principalmente a ""irmã caçula"" da Alemanha e do Japão. Apesar de terem construído quatro novos navios pouco antes do início da guerra, tinham um exército e uma marinha mais fracos. Os principais objetivos da Itália eram os países africanos. Para capturá-los, eles precisariam ter uma plataforma de lançamento de tropas, de modo que pudessem cruzar o Mar Mediterrâneo e invadir a África. Por isso, eles precisaram sumir com as bases e os navios britânicos no Egito. Além dessas ações, os navios de guerra italianos não deveriam fazer nada mais. Agora ao Japão. O Japão era um país insular, assim como o Reino Unido."
mt: "Let's start with an explanation of Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "younger sister" of Germany and Japan. Despite having built four new ships just before the start of the war, they had a weaker army and navy. Italy's main objectives were the African countries. To capture them, they needed a troop launching platform, so they could cross the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For this reason, they needed to sink the British bases and ships in Egypt. Apart from these actions, Italian warships should do nothing more. Now to Japan. Japan was an island country, just like the United Kingdom."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "Os desembarques e as seguintes batalhas no Dia D libertaram o norte da França, mas o sul ainda não estava livre. Era governado pelos franceses ""Vichy"". Eram franceses que fizeram as pazes com os alemães em 1940 e trabalharam com os invasores em vez de combatê-los. Em 15 de agosto de 1940, os Aliados invadiram o sul da França, a invasão foi chamada de ""Operação Dragão"". Em apenas duas semanas, as forças americanas e da França Livre haviam libertado o sul da França e estavam se voltando em direção à Alemanha."
mt: "The landings and the subsequent battles on D-Day freed the north of France, but the south was still not free. It was governed by the French "Vichy". They were the French who made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1940, the Allies invaded the south of France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragon". In just two weeks, American and Free French forces had liberated the south of France and were turning towards Germany."
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: "Os submarinos são embarcações projetadas para viajar debaixo d'água e permanecer lá por um longo período de tempo. Os submarinos foram usados na Primeira e Segunda Guerras Mundiais. Naquela época, eram muito lentos e tinham um campo de tiro muito limitado. Logo que a guerra se iniciou, eles viajavam especialmente sobre o mar, contudo, à medida que o radar começou a se desenvolver e se tornar mais preciso, para evitar que fossem vistos, os submarinos foram forçados a mergulhar. Os submarinos alemães eram chamados de ""U-boats"". Os alemães eram muito bons em operar e navegar os seus submarinos. Em razão do sucesso com submarinos, após a guerra, não se acreditava que os alemães possuíssem muitos deles."
mt: "Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater and stay there for a long period of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. At that time, they were very slow and had a very limited firing range. As soon as the war began, they traveled especially over the sea, but as the radar began to develop and become more accurate, to avoid being seen, the submarines were forced to dive. The German submarines were called ""U-boats"". The Germans were very good at operating and navigating their submarines. Because of the success with submarines, after the war, it was not believed that the Germans had many of them."
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: Em 17 de setembro de 1939, a defesa polonesa já estava destruída e a única saída era recuar e se reagrupar ao longo da cabeça de ponte romena. No entanto, esses planos tornaram-se obsoletos quase da noite para o dia, quando mais de 800 mil soldados do Exército Vermelho da União Soviética criaram as frentes bielorrussa e ucraniana após invadir as regiões orientais da Polônia em violação do Tratado de Paz de Riga, o Pacto de Não Agressão Soviética-Polonesa, e outros tratados internacionais, bilaterais e multilaterais.
mt: 17 September 1939, the Polish defense was already destroyed and the only option was to retreat and regroup along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans became obsolete almost overnight, when more than 800,000 soldiers of the Red Army of the Soviet Union created the Belorussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Treaty of Riga, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international, bilateral, and multilateral treaties.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: As coisas não deram certo para os italianos no Norte da África quase desde o início. Uma semana após a declaração de guerra da Itália em 10 de junho de 1940, os 11º Hussardos britânicos tomaram o Forte Capuzzo na Líbia. Em uma emboscada a leste de Bardia, os britânicos capturaram o engenheiro chefe do Décimo Exército italiano, general Lastucci. Em 28 de junho, o marechal Italo Balbo, governador-geral da Líbia e herdeiro aparente de Mussolini, foi morto por fogo amigo enquanto pousava em Tobruk.
mt: Things didn't go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. A week after Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars took Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the chief engineer of the Tenth Italian Army, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, governor-general of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: O budismo tibetano é baseado nos ensinamentos de Buda, mas foram ampliados pelo caminho do amor do Mahayana e por muitas técnicas do Yoga indiano. Em princípio, o budismo tibetano é muito simples. Ele consiste na Kundalini Yoga, na meditação e no caminho do amor abrangente. Com a Ioga Kundalini, a energia kundalini (energia  iluminadora) é despertada através das posturas da ioga, exercícios de respiração, mantras e visualizações. A parte central da meditação tibetana é o Deity Yoga. Através da visualização de várias divindades, os canais de energia são limpos, os chacras são ativados e a consciência da iluminação é criada.
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of the Buddha, but were expanded by the path of love of Mahayana and by many techniques of Indian Yoga. In principle, Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the all-embracing path of love. With Kundalini Yoga, the kundalini energy (illuminating energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The central part of Tibetan meditation is Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities, the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the consciousness of enlightenment is created.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga. In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love. With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.

src: O programa começou às 20h30 hora local (15.00 do Tempo Universal Coordenado). Cantores famosos ao longo do país ofereceram Bhajans, ou canções de devoção, aos pés de Shri Shyam. A noite começou com a apresentação do cantor Singer Sanju Sharma, acompanhado por Jai Shankar Choudhary. O chhappan bhog bhajan também foi apresentado. O cantor Raju Khandelwal estava o acompanhando. Então, Lakkha Singh tomou a frente para cantar os bhajans. 108 pratos de Chhappan Bhog (isto é, 56 comidas diferentes, como doces, frutas, nozes, pratos, etc. que no hinduísmo são oferecidos à divindade) foram servidos para Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh também apresentou o chhappan bhog bhajan. O cantor Raju Khandelwal estava acompanhando-o.
mt: The program began at 8:30 pm local time (3:00 pm UTC). Famous singers across the country offered Bhajans, or devotional songs, at the feet of Shri Shyam. The night began with the performance of singer Sanju Sharma, accompanied by Jai Shankar Choudhary. The chhappan bhog bhajan was also presented. Singer Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him. Then, Lakkha Singh took the lead to sing the bhajans. 108 plates of Chhappan Bhog (that is, 56 different foods, such as sweets, fruits, nuts, dishes, etc. that in Hinduism are offered to the deity) were served to Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh also presented the chhappan bhog bhajan. Singer Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him.

Singer Sanju Sharma started the evening, followed by Jai Shankar Choudhary. esented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him. Then, Lakkha Singh took the lead in singing the bhajans. 108 plates of Chhappan Bhog (in Hinduism, 56 different edible items, like, sweets, fruits, nuts, dishes etc. which are offered to deity) were served to Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh presented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him.

src: "As celebrações foram iniciadas com uma apresentação especial do grupo mundialmente famoso Cirque du Soleil. Seguiram-se a Orquestra Sinfônica Estatal de Istambul, uma banda de Janízaros e os cantores Fatih Erkoç e Müslüm Gürses. Em seguida, os Whirling Dervishes subiram ao palco. A diva turca Sezen Aksu se apresentou com o tenor italiano Alessandro Safina e o cantor grego Haris Alexiou. Para finalizar, o grupo de dança turco Fire of Anatolia apresentou o espetáculo ""Troy""."
mt: "The celebrations were kicked off with a special performance by the world-famous Cirque du Soleil. This was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band and singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses. Next, the Whirling Dervishes took the stage. Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. To finish, the Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia presented the show ""Troy""."
ref: "The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil. It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses. Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage. Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show ""Troy""."

src: "Os passageiros receberam água enquanto aguardavam no calor de 32 °C. ""Foi um dia quente em Santa Clara, com temperaturas na casa dos 32 °C"", relatou Scott Kouns, o capitão dos bombeiros. Qualquer período de tempo preso em uma montanha-russa seria desconfortável, para dizer o mínimo, e levaria pelo menos uma hora para tirar a primeira pessoa do passeio."""
mt: "Passengers were given water while waiting in the 32 °C heat. ""It was a hot day in Santa Clara, with temperatures in the 32 °C range"", said Scott Kouns, the fire captain. Any period of time stuck on a roller coaster would be uncomfortable, to say the least, and would take at least an hour to get the first person off the ride."""
ref: "Passengers were given water as they waited in 90(F)-degree heat. Fire captain Scott Kouns said, ""It was a hot day in the Santa Clara with temperatures in the 90s. Any length of time trapped on a roller coaster would be uncomfortable, to say the least, and it took at least an hour to get the first person off the ride."""

src: Segundo o último boletim, leituras do nível do mar indicaram o surgimento de um tsunami. Houve alguma atividade evidente de tsunami registrada próximo a Pago Pago e Niue. Não foram relatados danos ou ferimentos graves em Tonga, mas a ilha ficou temporariamente sem energia elétrica, o que impediu que as autoridades locais recebessem o alerta de tsunami enviado pelo PTWC. Quatorze escolas no Havaí localizadas na costa e nas proximidades foram fechadas durante toda a quarta-feira apesar dos avisos terem sido suspensos.
mt: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated the generation of a tsunami.  There was some apparent tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue.  No major damage or injuries were reported in Tonga, but the island temporarily lost power, which prevented local authorities from receiving the tsunami warning sent by the PTWC.  Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on the coast and nearby were closed for the entire Wednesday despite the warnings being suspended.
ref: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated a tsunami was generated. There was some definite tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue. No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC. Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted.

src: O copiloto da equipe A1GP da Nova Zelândia, Jonny Reid, fez história hoje ao dirigir legalmente da forma mais rápida sobre a Ponte do Porto de Auckland, Nova Zelândia, construída há 48 anos. O senhor Reid conseguiu dirigir um carro de GP de A!, Black Beauty, a velocidades acima de 160 km/h sete vezes sobre a ponte. A polícia da Nova Zelândia teve problemas para usar suas armas de radar de velocidade para ver o quão rápido o Sr. Reid estava indo por causa do quão baixo o Black Beauty é, e a única vez que a polícia conseguiu marcar o Sr. Reid foi quando ele diminuiu para 160Km/h.
mt: The co-driver of the New Zealand A1GP team, Jonny Reid, made history today by legally driving the fastest ever over Auckland Harbour Bridge, New Zealand, built 48 years ago. Mr. Reid managed to drive a GP of A! car, Black Beauty, at speeds above 160 km/h seven times over the bridge. The New Zealand police had problems using their speed radar guns to see how fast Mr. Reid was going because the Black Beauty is so low, and the only time the police managed to clock Mr. Reid was when he slowed down to 160Km/h.
ref: Jonny Reid, co-driver for the A1GP New Zealand team, today made history by driving the fastest over the 48-year-old Auckland Harbour Bridge, New Zealand, legally. Mr Reid managed to drive the New Zealand's A1GP car, Black Beauty at speeds over 160km/h seven times over the bridge. The New Zealand police had trouble using their speed radar guns to see how fast Mr Reid was going because of how low Black Beauty is, and the only time the police managed to clock Mr Reid was when he slowed down to 160km/h.

src: Um terremoto moderado fez o oeste de Montana tremer às 22h08 de segunda-feira. Nenhum relatório imediato sobre danos foi recebido pelo Serviço Geológico dos Estados Unidos (USGS) nem pelo Centro Nacional de Informações sobre Terremotos. O epicentro do tremor foi a cerca de 20 km (15 milhas) de distância do norte/nordeste de Dillon e a cerca de 65 km (40 milhas) do sul de Butte.
mt: A moderate earthquake shook western Montana at 10:08 p.m. Monday. No immediate reports of damage were received by the U.S. Geological Survey or the National Earthquake Information Center. The epicenter of the quake was about 20 km (15 miles) north-northeast of Dillon and about 65 km (40 miles) south of Butte.
ref: A moderate earthquake shook western Montana at 10:08 p.m. on Monday. No immediate reports of damage have been received by the United States Geological Survey (USGS) and its National Earthquake Information Center. The earthquake was centered about 20 km (15 miles) north-northeast of Dillon, and about 65 km (40 miles) south of Butte.

src: A penitenciária de Abu Ghraib no Iraque foi incendiada durante uma rebelião. A prisão se tornou notória após a descoberta de abuso aos prisioneiros após as forças dos Estados Unidos terem assumido.
mt: The Abu Ghraib prison in Iraq was set ablaze during a riot. The prison became notorious after the discovery of abuse of prisoners after U.S. forces took over.
ref: Iraq's Abu Ghraib prison has been set alight during a riot. The jail became notorious after prisoner abuse was discovered there after US forces took over.

src: O grupo cancelou o show no War Memorial Stadium de Maui (ele tinha previsão de que receberia 9.000 pessoas) e se desculpou com os fãs. A empresa de gestão responsável pela banda, a HK Management Inc., inicialmente não deu motivos para o cancelamento em 20 de setembro, mas culpou questões logísticas no dia seguinte.
mt: The group canceled the show at the War Memorial Stadium in Maui (it was expected to receive 9,000 people) and apologized to fans. The band's management company, HK Management Inc., initially did not give reasons for the cancellation on September 20, but blamed logistical issues the next day.
ref: The band canceled the show at Maui's War Memorial Stadium, which was set to be attended by 9,000 people, and apologized to fans. The band's management company, HK Management Inc., gave no initial reason when they canceled on September 20, but blamed logistical reasons by the next day.

src: "Dizem que os saques generalizados continuaram durante toda a noite, ao passo que não se via a polícia presente nas ruas de Bishkek. A cidade de Bisqueque era descrita como se estivesse afundando num estado de ""anarquia"", de acordo com um observador, já que mutirões de pessoas andavam pelas ruas e saqueavam as lojas de bens de consumo. Diversos residentes de Bishkek culparam os manifestantes do sul pela ilegalidade."
mt: "They say that the widespread looting continued throughout the night, while the police were not seen on the streets of Bishkek. The city of Bishkek was described as being in a state of "anarchy", according to an observer, as people were roaming the streets and looting the stores of consumer goods. Several residents of Bishkek blamed the southerners for the illegality."
ref: "Widespread looting reportedly continued overnight, as law enforcement officers were not present on Bishkek's streets. Bishkek was described as sinking into a state of ""anarchy"" by one observer, as gangs of people roamed the streets and plundered stores of consumer goods. Several Bishkek residents blamed protesters from the south for the lawlessness."

src: Anteriormente, o CEO da Ring, Jamie Siminoff, comentou que a empresa surgiu quando sua campainha não podia ser ouvida de sua loja em sua garagem. Ele montou uma campainha sem fio, disse. Siminoff afirmou que as vendas aumentaram após sua aparição de 2013 em um episódio do Shark Tank, no qual os jurados do programa recusaram o financiamento da startup. Siminoff foi exibido no canal de televisão de compras QVC, no final de 2017. A Ring ganhou também uma causa judicial contra a empresa de segurança concorrente, a ADT Corporation.
mt: Previously, Ring CEO Jamie Siminoff commented that the company came about when his doorbell couldn't be heard from his store in his garage. He built a wireless doorbell, he said. Siminoff said sales increased after his appearance in a 2013 episode of Shark Tank, in which the show's judges rejected the startup's funding. Siminoff was featured on the QVC shopping channel at the end of 2017. Ring also won a lawsuit against the competing security company, ADT Corporation.
ref: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage. He built a WiFi door bell, he said. Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup. In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC. Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.

src: "O programa da PBS tem mais de duas dúzias de Prêmios Emmy, e esteve no ar por menos tempo somente que Vila Sésamo e Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. Cada episódio do programa se concentrava no tema de um livro específico e, em seguida, explorava tal tema usando várias histórias. Cada programa também fornece recomendações de livros que as crianças devem procurar ao irem à biblioteca. John Grant, do WNED Buffalo (em português, ''Estação Doméstica de Reading Rainbow''), afirmou que: ""Reading Rainbow proporcionou o ensino da leitura às crianças, ... fez com que elas gostassem da leitura - [o programa] incentivou as crianças a lerem um livro."" Algumas pessoas, incluindo John Grant, acreditam que tanto a crise de financiamento quanto uma mudança na filosofia da programação educacional da televisão contribuíram para o fim da série."
mt: "The PBS program has more than two dozen Emmy Awards, and was on the air for less time than only Sesame Street and Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. Each episode of the program focused on the theme of a specific book and then explored that theme using several stories. Each program also provided book recommendations that children should look for when going to the library. John Grant, of WNED Buffalo (in English, "Reading Rainbow's Domestic Station"), said that: ""Reading Rainbow taught children how to read,... made them like reading - [the program] encouraged children to read a book."" Some people, including John Grant, believe that both the funding crisis and a change in the educational programming philosophy of television contributed to the end of the series."
ref: "The PBS show has more than two-dozen Emmy awards, and its run is shorter only than Sesame Street and Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. Each episode of the show would focus on a theme in a specific book and then explore that theme through multiple stories. Each show would also provide recommendations for books that children should look for when they went to their library. John Grant, from WNED Buffalo (Reading Rainbow's home station) said ""Reading Rainbow taught kids why to read,... the love of reading — [the show] encouraged kids to pick up a book and to read."" It is believed by some, including John Grant, that both the funding crunch and a shift in the philosophy of educational television programming contributed to ending the series."

src: Funcionários da cidade de Amsterdã e o Museu Anne Frank declaram que a árvore está infectada com um fungo e representa um risco à saúde pública, pois argumentam que ela estava em perigo iminente de cair. O corte estava agendado para terça-feira, mas foi suspenso após uma decisão judicial de emergência.
mt: City of Amsterdam officials and the Anne Frank Museum declared that the tree is infected with a fungus and represents a public health risk, as they argued that it was in imminent danger of falling. The cutting was scheduled for Tuesday, but was suspended after an emergency injunction.
ref: Officials for the city of Amsterdam and the Anne Frank Museum state that the tree is infected with a fungus and poses a public health hazard as they argue that it was in imminent danger of falling over. It had been scheduled to be cut down on Tuesday, but was saved after an emergency court ruling.

src: "A Animal Liberation e a Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) mais uma vez clamam pela instalação obrigatória de câmeras de segurança em todos os abatedouros australianos. O inspetor-chefe da RSPCA de Nova Gales do Sul, David O'Shannessy, disse à ABC que a vigilância e as inspeções de matadouros deveriam ser ordinárias na Austrália. ""O CFTV certamente enviaria uma forte mensagem para as pessoas que trabalham com animais de que seu bem-estar é a mais alta prioridade."""
mt: "The Animal Liberation and the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) once again call for the mandatory installation of security cameras in all Australian abattoirs. NSW RSPCA chief inspector David O'Shannessy told the ABC that surveillance and abattoir inspections should be routine in Australia. ""CCTV certainly sends a strong message to people working with animals that their welfare is the highest priority."""
ref: "Animal Liberation and the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) are again calling for the mandatory installation of CCTV cameras in all Australian abattoirs. RSPCA New South Wales chief inspector David O'Shannessy told the ABC that surveillance and inspections of abattoirs should be commonplace in Australia. ""The CCTV would certainly send a strong signal to those people working with animals that their welfare is of the highest priority."""

src: A notícia voou pela comunidade de Red Lake hoje como funerais para Jeff Weise e três das nove vítimas foram paradas que outro estudante chegou à prisão em ligação com o tiroteio na escola de 21 de março. Além da confirmação da prisão de hoje, as autoridades prestaram poucas informações oficialmente. No entanto, uma fonte que está a par da investigação disse ao Minneapolis Star-Tribune que foi Louis Jourdain, o filho de 16 anos do chefe da tribo Red Lake, Floyd Jourdain. Não se sabe até o momento quais acusações serão feitas ou o que levou as autoridades ao garoto, mas procedimentos juvenis começaram na corte federal.
mt: The news flew through the Red Lake community today as funerals for Jeff Weise and three of the nine victims were halted when another student arrived at jail in connection with the school shooting of March 21. In addition to the confirmation of the arrest today, authorities provided few official information. However, a source familiar with the investigation told the Minneapolis Star-Tribune that it was Louis Jourdain, the 16-year-old son of Red Lake tribal chief Floyd Jourdain. It is not yet known what charges will be filed or what led authorities to the boy, but juvenile proceedings began in federal court.
ref: News spread in the Red Lake community today as funerals for Jeff Weise and three of the nine victims were held that another student was arrested in connection with the school shootings of March 21. Authorities said little officially beyond confirming today's arrest. However, a source with knowledge of the investigation told the Minneapolis Star-Tribune that it was Louis Jourdain, 16-year old son of Red Lake Tribal Chairman Floyd Jourdain. It is not known at this time what charges will be laid or what led authorities to the boy but juvenile proceedings have begun in federal court.

src: Os organizadores do protesto informaram que cerca de 100.000 pessoas compareceram a cidades alemãs como Berlim, Colônia, Hamburgo e Hanover. Em Berlim, a polícia estimou 6.500 manifestantes. Protestos também ocorreram em Paris, Sofia na Bulgária, Vilnius na Lituânia, Valetta em Malta, Tallinn na Estônia e Edimburgo e Glasgow na Escócia. Em Londres, cerca de 200 pessoas protestaram do lado de fora dos escritórios de alguns dos principais detentores de direitos autorais. No mês passado, houve grandes protestos na Polônia, quando o país assinou o ACTA, o que levou o governo polonês a decidir não ratificar o acordo por enquanto. A Letônia e a Eslováquia postergaram o processo de se juntar ao ACTA.
mt: Organizers of the protest reported that about 100,000 people attended cities in Germany such as Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg and Hanover. In Berlin, police estimated 6,500 protesters. Protests also occurred in Paris, Sofia in Bulgaria, Vilnius in Lithuania, Valetta in Malta, Tallinn in Estonia and Edinburgh and Glasgow in Scotland. In London, about 200 people protested outside the offices of some of the main copyright holders. Last month, there were large protests in Poland, when the country signed the ACTA, which led the Polish government to decide not to ratify the agreement for now. Latvia and Slovakia postponed the process of joining the ACTA.
ref: Organisers of the protest said about 100,000 people turned up in German cities such as Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg, and Hanover. In Berlin, police estimated 6,500 protestors. Protests also took place in Paris, Sofia in Bulgaria, Vilnius in Lithuania, Valetta in Malta, Tallinn in Estonia, and Edinburgh and Glasgow in Scotland. In London, about 200 people protested outside some major copyright holders' offices. Last month, there were major protests in Poland when that country signed ACTA, which has led to the Polish government deciding not to ratify the agreement, for now. Latvia and Slovakia have both delayed the process of joining ACTA.

Latvia and Slovakia have both delayed the process of joining ACTA.

src: "Cerca de 60 casos de iPods com problemas de superaquecimento foram relatados, causando um total de seis incêndios e deixando quatro pessoas com queimaduras leves. O Ministério da Economia, Comércio e Indústria do Japão (METI) disse estar ciente de 27 acidentes relacionados aos dispositivos. Na semana passada, o METI divulgou que a Apple o havia informado de mais 34 incidentes de superaquecimento, os quais a empresa classificou como ""não graves"". O ministério respondeu chamando o adiamento do relatório da Apple de ""verdadeiramente lamentável""."
mt: "About 60 cases of iPods with overheating problems were reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns. The Japanese Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said it was aware of 27 incidents related to the devices. Last week, METI disclosed that Apple had informed it of another 34 overheating incidents, which the company classified as ""not serious"". The ministry responded by calling Apple's delay in reporting the incidents ""truly regrettable""."
ref: "Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns. Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices. Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called ""non-serious."" The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report ""truly regrettable."""

src: "Steve Jobs, CEO da Apple, entrou no palco e anunciou o dispositivo quando tirou o iPhone do bolso de sua calça. Durante o seu discurso de 2 horas, ele afirmou que ""Hoje a Apple vai reinventar o telefone. Nós vamos fazer história hoje""."
mt: "Steve Jobs, CEO of Apple, entered the stage and announced the device when he pulled the iPhone out of his pants pocket. During his two-hour speech, he said ""Today Apple will reinvent the phone. We're going to make history today.""
ref: "Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveiled the device by walking onto the stage and taking the iPhone out of his jeans pocket. During his 2 hour speech he stated that ""Today Apple is going to reinvent the phone, We are going to make history today""."

src: A atual senadora e primeira-dama da Argentina Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner anunciou sua candidatura à presidência ontem à tarde em La Plata, cidade distante 50 quilômetros (31 milhas) de Buenos Aires. A senhora Kirchner anunciou sua intenção de se candidatar a presidente no Teatro Argentina, o mesmo local que ela usou para iniciar sua campanha ao senado em 2005 como membro da delegação da província de Buenos Aires.
mt: The current senator and first lady of Argentina Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her candidacy for president yesterday afternoon in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) from Buenos Aires. Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Teatro Argentina, the same location she used to start her campaign for the senate in 2005 as a member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.
ref: Current senator and Argentine First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her presidential candidacy yesterday evening in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires. Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.

src: A ACMA também constatou que, apesar da transmissão na Internet, o Big Brother não violou as leis de censura de conteúdo on-line, pois a mídia não foi postada no site oficial. O Broadcasting Services Act prevê a regulação do conteúdo na internet, mas para que algo seja considerado como tal, deve residir fisicamente em um servidor.
mt: The ACMA also found that, despite the Internet transmission, the Big Brother did not violate online content censorship laws, as the media was not posted on the official site. The Broadcasting Services Act regulates content on the Internet, but for something to be considered as such, it must reside physically on a server.
ref: The ACMA also found that despite the video being streamed on the Internet, Big Brother had not breached online content censorship laws as the media had not been stored on Big Brother's website. The Broadcasting Services Act provides for the regulation of Internet content, however to be considered Internet content, it must physically reside on a server.

src: "Peter Costello, um tesoureiro da Austrália e o homem com mais chance de suceder o primeiro-ministro John Howard como líder do partido liberal, declarou seu apoio a uma possível indústria de energia nuclear na Austrália. O senhor Costello afirmou que quando a geração de energia nuclear se tornar viável economicamente, a Austrália deve procurar usá-la. ""Se isso se tornar comercial, nós devemos tê-lo. Ou seja, em tese não há impedimento à energia nuclear"", informou o senhor Costello."
mt: "Peter Costello, Australia's treasurer and the man most likely to succeed Prime Minister John Howard as leader of the Liberal Party, declared his support for a possible nuclear energy industry in Australia. Mr. Costello said that when nuclear power generation becomes economically viable, Australia should seek to use it. ""If it becomes commercially viable, we should have it. That is, in principle, there is no impediment to nuclear power"", Mr. Costello said."
ref: "Peter Costello, Australian treasurer and the man most likely to succeed Prime Minister John Howard as Liberal party leader has thrown his support behind a nuclear power industry in Australia. Mr Costello said that when nuclear power generation becomes economically viable, Australia should pursue its use. ""If it becomes commercial, we should have it. That is, there's no in-principle objection to nuclear energy"" Mr Costello said."

src: Com apenas dezoito medalhas disponíveis por dia, um número considerável de países não conseguiu ganhar medalhas. Eles incluem a Holanda, com Anna Jochemsen ficando na nona posição na categoria standing (em pé) feminino no Super-G de ontem, e a Finlândia, com Katja Saarinen ficando na décima posição no mesmo evento. Mitchell Gourley, australiano, terminou de pé em 11º no Super-G masculino. O concorrente tcheco, Oldrich Jelinek, finalizou sentado em 16º no Super-G masculino. Arly Velasquez, do México, terminou em décimo quinto no Super-G para cadeirantes masculino. Adam Hall, da Nova Zelândia, terminou em nono no Super-G para não cadeirantes masculino. O esquiador polonês com deficiência visual Maciej Krezel e a guia Anna Ogarzynska terminaram em décimo terceiro lugar no Super-G. Jong Seork Park da Coreia do Sul terminou em vigésimo quarto lugar no Super-G masculino na modalidade sentada.
mt: With only eighteen medals available per day, a considerable number of countries failed to win medals. These include the Netherlands, with Anna Jochemsen finishing ninth in the standing (up) female Super-G yesterday, and Finland, with Katja Saarinen finishing tenth in the same event. Mitchell Gourley, Australian, finished up in 11th in the men's Super-G. Czech competitor Oldrich Jelinek finished seated in 16th in the men's Super-G. Arly Velasquez, of Mexico, finished fifteenth in the men's Super-G for seated competitors. Adam Hall, of New Zealand, finished ninth in the men's Super-G for non-seated competitors. Polish visually impaired skier Maciej Krezel and guide Anna Ogarzynska finished thirteenth in the Super-G. Jong Seork Park of South Korea finished twenty-fourth in the men's Super-G seated.
ref: With only eighteen medals available a day, a number of countries have failed to make the medal podium. They include the Netherlands, with Anna Jochemsen finishing ninth in the women's standing class in the Super-G yesterday, and Finland with Katja Saarinen finishing tenth in the same event. Australia's Mitchell Gourley finished eleventh in the men's standing Super-G. Czech competitor Oldrich Jelinek finished sixteenth in the men's sitting Super-G. Arly Velasquez of Mexico finished fifteenth in the men's sitting Super-G. New Zealand's Adam Hall finished ninth in the men's standing Super-G. Poland's men's visually impaired skier Maciej Krezel and guide Anna Ogarzynska finished thirteenth in the Super-G. South Korea's Jong Seork Park finished twenty-fourth in the men's sitting Super-G.

src: "O julgamento aconteceu em Birmingham Crown Court e foi fechado no dia 3 de agosto. O apresentador, que foi preso no local, negou a agressão e afirmou ter usado o mastro para se proteger de garrafas que umas trinta pessoas estavam atirando contra ele. O Blake também foi condenado por tentar obstruir a justiça. O juiz Blake disse que era ""quase inevitável"" ele ser mandado para a prisão."
mt: "The trial took place at Birmingham Crown Court and was closed on August 3. The presenter, who was arrested at the scene, denied the assault and said he used the baton to protect himself from bottles that some thirty people were throwing at him. Blake was also convicted of attempting to obstruct justice. The judge Blake said it was ""almost inevitable"" he would be sent to prison."
ref: "The trial took place at Birmingham Crown Court and concluded on August 3. The presenter, who was arrested at the scene, denied the attack and claimed he used the pole to protect himself from bottles being thrown at him by up to thirty people. Blake was also convicted of attempting to pervert the course of justice. The judge told Blake it was ""almost inevitable"" he was going to be sent to jail."

src: Outros assuntos na agenda em Bali incluem salvar as florestas remanescentes do mundo e compartilhar tecnologias para auxiliar as nações em desenvolvimento a crescer de maneiras menos poluentes. A ONU também espera concluir um fundo para ajudar os países afetados pelo aquecimento global a lidar com os impactos. O dinheiro poderia ir para as casas à prova de inundações, para uma melhor gestão da água, assim como, para a diversificação das safras.
mt: Other issues on the agenda in Bali include saving the world's remaining forests and sharing technologies to help developing nations grow in less-polluting ways. The U.N. also hopes to conclude a fund to help countries affected by global warming deal with the impacts. The money could go toward flood-proof homes, better water management, as well as crop diversification.
ref: Other subjects on the agenda in Bali include saving the world's remaining forests, and sharing technologies to help developing nations grow in less-polluting ways. The U.N. also hopes to finalize a fund to help countries affected by global warming to cope with the impacts. The money could go toward flood-proof houses, better water management, and crop diversification.

src: "A Nigéria anunciou antes que pretendia ingressar no AfCFTA na semana anterior à cúpula. Albert Muchanga, comissário de Comércio e Indústria da UA, comunicou que Benin iria juntar-se. O comissário disse: ""Ainda não chegamos a um acordo sobre as regras de origem e as concessões tarifárias, mas a estrutura que temos é suficiente para começar a negociar em 1º de julho de 2020""."
mt: "Nigeria announced before that it would join the AfCFTA the week before the summit. Albert Muchanga, Commissioner of Trade and Industry of the AU, reported that Benin would join. The commissioner said: ""We have not yet reached an agreement on the rules of origin and tariff concessions, but the structure we have is sufficient to start negotiating on July 1, 2020."""
ref: "Nigeria previously announced it planned to join the AfCFTA in the week leading up to the summit. AU trade and industry commissioner Albert Muchanga announced Benin was to join. The commissioner said, ""We haven't yet agreed on rules of origin and tariff con[c]essions, but the framework we have is enough to start trading on July 1, 2020""."

src: Durante sua estada em Atlanta, ela foi elogiada pela crítica e reconhecida por seu modelo inovador de educação urbana. Em 2009 recebeu o título de Superintendente Nacional do Ano. Na época da premiação, as escolas de Atlanta viram um grande aumento nas pontuações dos testes. Pouco depois, o Atlanta Journal-Constitution publicou um relatório mostrando problemas com os resultados dos testes. O relatório mostrou que as notas subiram de maneira estranhamente rápida e alegou que a escola detectou problemas internamente, mas não tomou nenhuma providência. A evidência, então, indicou que os testes foram adulterados. Hall e outros outros 34 oficiais de educação foram indiciados.
mt: During her stay in Atlanta, she was praised by the press and recognized for her innovative urban education model. In 2009 she received the title of Superintendent of the Year. At the time of the award, Atlanta schools saw a large increase in test scores. Shortly after, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution published a report showing problems with test results. The report showed that the scores rose strangely quickly and alleged that the school detected internal problems, but took no action. The evidence then indicated that the tests were tampered with. Hall and other 34 education officials were indicted.
ref: She gained critical acclaim during her time in Atlanta and was recognized for innovative urban education. In 2009 she was awarded the title of National Superintendent of the Year. At the time of the award, Atlanta schools had seen a large improvement on test scores. Shortly after, The Atlanta Journal-Constitution published a report showing problems with test results. The report showed test scores had increased implausibly fast, and alleged the school internally detected problems but didn't act on the findings. Evidence thereafter indicated test papers were tampered with Hall, along with 34 other education officials, was indicted in 2013.

src: Uma bomba explodiu do lado de fora do escritório do governador geral. Mais três bombas explodiram perto dos prédios do governo em um período de duas horas. Alguns relatórios dizem que o número oficial de mortos foi oito, e outros confirmam que até 30 ficaram feridas; mas os números finais ainda não são conhecidos.
mt: A bomb exploded outside the governor general's office. Three more bombs exploded near government buildings in a two-hour period. Some reports say the official death toll was eight, and others confirm that up to 30 were injured; but the final numbers are still unknown.
ref: One bomb exploded outside the governor general's office. Three more bombs exploded near government buildings in a period of two hours. Some reports put the official death toll at eight, and official reports confirm that up to 30 were injured; but final numbers are not yet known.

src: Gabriel Jesus, de 21 anos, foi contratado pelo Manchester City em janeiro de 2017. Ele veio do Palmeiras, um clube brasileiro, no valor de 27 milhões de euros. O brasileiro, desde então, marcou 24 gols e jogou 53 partidas pelo clube em todas as competições.
mt: 21-year-old Gabriel Jesus was signed by Manchester City in January 2017. He came from Brazilian club Palmeiras for a fee of €27 million. The Brazilian has since scored 24 goals and played 53 games for the club in all competitions.
ref: 21-year-old Jesus joined Manchester City last year in January 2017 from Brazilian club Palmeiras for a reported fee of £27 million. Since then, the Brazilian has featured in 53 matches for the club in all competitions and has scored 24 goals.

src: Um albergue desabou em Meca, a cidade sagrada do Islã, por volta das 10 horas desta manhã, no horário local. O edifício hospedava vários peregrinos que haviam chegado para visitar a cidade santa por ocasião do hajj. A maioria dos hóspedes da pousada eram cidadãos dos Emirados Árabes Unidos. O número de mortos é de ao menos 15 e deve aumentar.
mt: A hostel collapsed in Mecca, the holy city of Islam, around 10 a.m. local time this morning. The building housed several pilgrims who had arrived to visit the holy city for the hajj. Most of the hostel's guests were citizens of the United Arab Emirates. The death toll is at least 15 and is expected to rise.
ref: A hostel collapsed in Mecca, the holy city of Islam at about 10 o'clock this morning local time. The building housed a number of pilgrims who came to visit the holy city at the eve of hajj pilgrimage. The hostel's guests were mostly citizens of the United Arab Emirates. The death toll is at least 15, a figure which is expected to rise.

src: Um albergue desabou em Meca, a cidade sagrada do Islã, por volta das 10 horas desta manhã, no horário local. O edifício hospedava vários peregrinos que haviam chegado para visitar a cidade santa por ocasião do hajj. A maioria dos hóspedes da pousada eram cidadãos dos Emirados Árabes Unidos. O número de mortos é de ao menos 15 e deve aumentar.
mt: A hostel collapsed in Mecca, the holy city of Islam, around 10 a.m. local time this morning. The building housed several pilgrims who had arrived to visit the holy city for the hajj. Most of the hostel's guests were citizens of the United Arab Emirates. The death toll is at least 15 and is expected to rise.
ref: A hostel collapsed in Mecca, the holy city of Islam at about 10 o'clock this morning local time. The building housed a number of pilgrims who came to visit the holy city at the eve of hajj pilgrimage. The hostel's guests were mostly citizens of the United Arab Emirates. The death toll is at least 15, a figure which is expected to rise.

src: Os satélites, ambos com peso superior a 1.000 libras e viajando a aproximadamente 17.500 milhas por hora, colidiram a 491 milhas de altitude. Os cientistas dizem que a explosão causada pela colisão foi intensa. Eles ainda estão tentando determinar o tamanho do acidente e como a terra será afetada. O Comando Estratégico dos Estados Unidos, do gabinete do Departamento de Defesa, está rastreando os destroços. O resultado da análise do gráfico será disponibilizado no site público.
mt: The satellites, both weighing more than 1,000 pounds and traveling at about 17,500 miles per hour, collided at 491 miles altitude. Scientists say the explosion caused by the collision was intense. They are still trying to determine the size of the accident and how the earth will be affected. The United States Strategic Command, the office of the Department of Defense, is tracking the debris. The result of the graph analysis will be made available on the public website.
ref: The satellites, both of which weighed in excess of 1,000 pounds, and traveling at approximately 17,500 miles per hour, collided 491 miles above the Earth. Scientists say the explosion caused by the collision was massive. They are still trying to determine just how large the crash was and how the Earth will be affected. The United States Strategic Command of the U.S. Department of Defense office is tracking the debris. The result of plotting analysis will be posted to a public website.

src: Baten ficou na 190° posição na lista dos 400 americanos mais ricos de 2008, com uma fortuna estimada em 2,3 bilhões de dólares. Ele se formou pelo College of Arts & Sciences da Universidade de Virgínia em 1950 e foi um significativo doador para essa instituição.
mt: Baten was ranked 190th on the 2008 list of the 400 richest Americans, with an estimated fortune of $2.3 billion. He graduated from the College of Arts & Sciences at the University of Virginia in 1950 and was a significant donor to that institution.
ref: Batten was ranked 190th on the 2008 400 Richest Americans list with an estimated fortune of $2.3 billion. He graduated from the College of Arts & Sciences of the University of Virginia in 1950 and was a significant donor to that institution.

src: "O governador da Califórnia, Arnold Schwarzenegger, sancionou um projeto de lei que proíbe vender ou alugar videogames violentos para menores. O projeto requer que os jogos eletrônicos violentos vendidos no estado da California sejam etiquetados com um rótulo no qual se lê ""18"" e torna sua venda a um menor de idade punível com multa de mil dólares por infração."
mt: "California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger signed a bill that prohibits the sale or rental of violent video games to minors. The bill requires violent video games sold in the state of California to be labeled with a label that reads ""18"" and makes the sale of such games to a minor punishable by a fine of $1,000 per infraction."
ref: "California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger signed into law a bill that bans the sale or rental of violent video games to minors. The bill requires violent video games sold in the state of California to be labeled with a decal reading ""18"" and makes their sale to a minor punishable by a fine of $1000 per offense."

src: "Duvall, que é casado e tem dois filhos adultos, não deixou grande impressão em Miller, a quem a história foi relatada. Ao pedirem um comentário seu, Miller disse, ""Mike fala muito durantes a audiência... eu estava me preparando, então não estava prestando muita atenção no que ele estava dizendo""."
mt: "Duvall, who is married and has two adult children, didn't leave much of an impression on Miller, who was told the story. Asked for a comment, Miller said, ""Mike talks a lot during the hearing... I was getting ready, so I wasn't paying much attention to what he was saying.""
ref: "Duvall, who is married with two adult children, did not leave a big impression on Miller, to whom the story was related. When asked for comment, Miller said, ""Mike talks a lot during the hearing...I was getting ready so I wasn't really hearing what he was saying."""

src: "O primeiro-ministro Stephen Harper concordou em enviar a ""Lei do Ar Limpo"" do governo a um comitê de todos os partidos para revisão, antes de sua segunda leitura, após a reunião de 25 minutos de terça-feira com o líder do NDP Jack Layton no PMO. Layton solicitou alterações no projeto de lei ambiental dos conservadores durante encontro com o primeiro-ministro, pedindo por uma ""reescrita minuciosa e completa"" do projeto de lei ambiental do partido Conservador. Desde quando o governo federal interveio para tomar conta do financiamento do hospital Mersey em Devonport, Tasmânia, o governo estadual e alguns deputados federais não gostaram desse ato e o classificaram como uma manobra no prelúdio da eleição federal que irá ser convocada em novembro. Mas o primeiro-ministro John Howard disse que o ato foi apenas para proteger as instalações do hospital de serem rebaixadas pelo governo da Tasmânia dando 45 milhões de dólares australianos mais."
mt: "Prime Minister Stephen Harper agreed to send the government's "Clean Air Act" to a committee of all parties for review, before its second reading, after Tuesday's 25-minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton in the PMO. Layton asked for changes to the Conservative party's environmental bill during his meeting with the prime minister, asking for a ""thorough and complete rewrite"" of the party's environmental bill. Since when the federal government intervened to take over the funding of the Mersey Hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs did not like this act and classified it as a maneuver in the prelude to the federal election that will be called in November. But Prime Minister John Howard said the act was only to protect the hospital's facilities from being downgraded by the Tasmanian government giving 45 million Australian dollars more."
ref: "Prime Minister Stephen Harper has agreed to send the government's 'Clean Air Act' to an all-party committee for review, before its second reading, after Tuesday's 25 minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton at the PMO. Layton had asked for changes to the conservatives' environmental bill during the meeting with the PM, asking for a ""thorough and complete rewriting"" of the Conservative party's environmental bill. Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November. But Prime Minister John Howard has said the act was only to safeguard the facilities of the hospital from being downgraded by the Tasmanian government, in giving an extra AUD$45 million."

src: Tanto o ácido cianúrico como a melanina foram encontrados em amostras de urina de animais de estimação que morreram depois de ingerir a ração contaminada. Os dois compostos reagem um com o outro para formar cristais que podem bloquear a função renal, afirmaram os pesquisadores da universidade. Os pesquisadores que cristais se formavam na urina de gato quando eram adicionados melanina e ácido cianúrico. A composição de tais cristais corresponde ao composto encontrado na urina de animais de estimação que foram atingidos, quando essas duas composições são comparadas utilizando-se  infravermelho por transformada de Fourier  (FTIR).
mt: Cyanuric acid and melanin were found in urine samples of pets that died after eating the tainted food. The two compounds react with each other to form crystals that can block kidney function, researchers said. Researchers found crystals formed in cat urine when they added melanin and cyanuric acid. The composition of such crystals corresponds to the compound found in the urine of pets that were affected, when these two compositions are compared using Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FTIR).
ref: Both cyanuric acid and melamine were found in urine samples from pets that died after consuming contaminated pet food. The two compounds react with one another to form crystals that may block kidney function, researchers at the university said. The researchers observed crystals formed in cat urine by the addition of melamine and cyanuric acid. The composition of these crystals matches those found in the urine of affected pets when compared by infrared spectroscopy (FTIR).

src: "A Xinhua informou que os investigadores do governo recuperaram duas ""caixas pretas"", gravadores de dados de voo, na quarta-feira. Outros lutadores também prestaram homenagem a Luna. Tommy Dreamer disse que ""Luna foi a primeira Rainha do Extremo. Minha primeira empresária. Luna faleceu em uma noite com duas luas. Algo excepcional, assim como ela. Mulher forte"". Dustin Goldust Runnels falou: ""Luna era tão louca quanto eu ... ou talvez até mais ... eu a amei e sentirei sua falta ... tomara que ela esteja em um lugar melhor."""
mt: "Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two ""black boxes"", flight data recorders, on Wednesday. Other wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna. Tommy Dreamer said that ""Luna was the first Queen of the Extreme. My first manager. Luna died on a night with two moons. Something exceptional, just like her. Strong woman."" Dustin Goldust Runnels spoke: ""Luna was as crazy as I... or maybe even more... I loved her and will miss her... I hope she is in a better place.""
ref: "Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday. Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna. Tommy Dreamer said ""Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."" Dustin ""Goldust"" Runnels commented that ""Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."""

src: Apesar de três pessoas estarem dentro da casa quando ela foi atingida pelo carro, nenhuma delas ficou ferida. No entanto, o motorista sofreu ferimentos graves na cabeça. A estrada onde ocorreu o acidente foi temporariamente fechada enquanto os serviços de emergência soltaram o motorista do Audi TT vermelho. Inicialmente, ele foi hospitalizado no James Paget Hospital, em Great Yarmouth. Posteriormente, ele foi transferido para o Addenbrooke's Hospital em Cambridge.
mt: Despite three people being inside the house when it was hit by the car, none of them were injured. However, the driver suffered serious head injuries. The road where the accident occurred was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver of the red Audi TT. Initially, he was taken to the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth. He was later transferred to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.
ref: Although three people were inside the house when the car impacted it, none of them were hurt. However, the driver sustained serious injuries to the head. The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT. He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth. He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.

src: Os jogos começaram às 10h com bom tempo e, apesar da garoa rápida do meio da manhã , foi um dia perfeito para o rugby de 7. A principal seleção do torneio, a África do Sul, começou com pé direito conquistando uma vitória confortável por 26 a 0 sobre a 5ª colocada, a Zâmbia. Aparentando claramente enferrujada no jogo contra as suas irmãs do sul, a África do Sul, no entanto, melhorava consistentemente à medida que o torneio avançada. Sua defesa disciplinada, a habilidade de lidar com a bola e o trabalho em equipe excelente fizeram com que eles se destacassem e ficou claro que essa era equipe a ser vencida.
mt: The games began at 10am with good weather and, despite a quick drizzle in the middle of the morning, it was a perfect day for rugby 7. The main team of the tournament, South Africa, started with a comfortable victory by 26 to 0 over the 5th placed, Zambia. Clearly rusted in the game against their southern sisters, South Africa, however, improved consistently as the tournament advanced. Its disciplined defense, ball handling ability and excellent teamwork made them stand out and it was clear that this was the team to beat.
ref: The games kicked off at 10:00am with great weather and apart from mid morning drizzle which quickly cleared up, it was a perfect day for 7's rugby. Tournament top seeds South Africa started on the right note when they had a comfortable 26 - 00 win against 5th seeded Zambia. Looking decidedly rusty in the game against their southern sisters, South Africa however steadily improved as the tournament progressed. Their disciplined defence, ball handling skills and excellent team work made them stand out and it was clear that this was the team to beat.

src: Durante as últimas três décadas, apesar de oficialmente permanecer como um Estado comunista, a China desenvolveu uma economia de mercado. As primeiras reformas econômicas foram feitas sob a liderança de Deng Xiaoping. Desde então, a economia da China cresceu 90 vezes. Pela primeira vez, no ano passado a China exportou mais carros do que a Alemanha e passou os Estados Unidos como maior mercado nesse setor. Dentro de duas décadas, o PIB da China poderá ultrapassar o dos Estados Unidos.
mt: During the last three decades, despite officially remaining as a communist state, China has developed a market economy. The first economic reforms were made under the leadership of Deng Xiaoping. Since then, China's economy has grown 90 times. For the first time last year, China exported more cars than Germany and passed the United States as the largest market in this sector. Within two decades, China's GDP may surpass that of the United States.
ref: During the last three decades, despite officially remaining a communist state, China has developed a market economy. The first economic reforms were made under the leadership of Deng Xiaoping. Since then, China's economic size has grown by 90 times. For the first time, last year China exported more cars than Germany and surpassed the United States as the biggest market for this industry. China's GDP could be larger than the United States within two decades.

src: """Nós nos esforçaremos para reduzir significativamente as emissões de dióxido de carbono por unidade do PIB até 2020, em relação ao nível de 2005,"" disse Hu. Ele não definiu um valor para os cortes, falando que eles serão feitos de acordo com a produção econômica da China. Hu encorajou os países em desenvolvimento ""a evitar o antigo caminho de poluir primeiro e limpar depois"". Ele adicionou que ""eles não devem, no entanto, ser solicitados a assumir obrigações que vão além de seu estágio de desenvolvimento, responsabilidade e capacidades."""
mt: """We will endeavor to significantly reduce carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by 2020, compared to the 2005 level,"" Hu said. He did not define a value for the cuts, saying they will be made in line with China's economic output. Hu encouraged developing countries ""to avoid the old path of polluting first and cleaning up later."" He added that ""they should not, however, be asked to assume obligations that go beyond their stage of development, responsibility and capabilities."""
ref: """We will endeavour to cut carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a notable margin by 2020 from the 2005 level,"" Hu said. He did not set a figure for the cuts, saying they will be made based on China's economic output. Hu encouraged developing countries ""to avoid the old path of polluting first and cleaning up later."" He added that ""they should not, however, be asked to take on obligations that go beyond their development stage, responsibility and capabilities."""

src: "As instituições de caridade médica Mangola, Medecins Sans Frontieres e a Organização Mundial da Saúde, afirmam que é o pior surto registrado no país. O Porta-voz do Medecines Sans Frontiere, Medecines Sans Frontiere, disse: ""A Angola está caminhando para seu pior surto de todos os tempos, a situação continua muito ruim no país."""
mt: "Mangola medical charities, Medecins Sans Frontieres and the World Health Organization say it is the worst outbreak recorded in the country. Medecins Sans Frontieres spokesman Medecins Sans Frontieres said: ""Angola is walking towards its worst outbreak of all time, the situation continues to be very bad in the country."""
ref: "The medical charity Mangola, Medecines Sans Frontieres and the World Health Organisation say it is the worst outbreak recorded in the country. Spokesman for Medecines Sans Frontiere Richard Veerman said: ""Angola is heading for its worst ever outbreak and the situation remains very bad in Angola,"" he said."

src: O Diretor de Promotoria Pública, Kier Starmer QC, deu uma declaração esta manhã anunciando a acusação de Huhne e Pryce. Huhne renunciou e será substituído no Gabinete por Ed Davey MP. Se espera que Norman Lamb MP assuma o cargo de Ministro de Negócios que Davey está desocupando. Huhne e Pryce devem aparecer no Tribunal de Magistrados de Westminster em 16 de fevereiro.
mt: The Director of Public Prosecutions, Kier Starmer QC, made a statement this morning announcing the charges against Huhne and Pryce. Huhne has resigned and will be replaced in the Cabinet by Ed Davey MP. It is expected that Norman Lamb MP will take over the Business Secretary role that Davey is vacating. Huhne and Pryce are expected to appear at Westminster Magistrates' Court on 16 February.
ref: The Director of Public Prosecutions, Kier Starmer QC, gave a statement this morning announcing the prosecution of both Huhne and Pryce. Huhne has resigned and he will be replaced in the Cabinet by Ed Davey MP. Norman Lamb MP is expected to take the Business Minister job Davey is vacating. Huhne and Pryce are scheduled to appear at the Westminster Magistrates Court on February 16.

src: "A história apresentada na ópera francesa, por Camille Saint-Saëns, é sobre um artista ""cuja vida é ditada pelo amor às drogas e ao Japão."" Como resultado, os atores fumam baseados de maconha no palco, e o próprio teatro incentiva o público a se juntar a eles."
mt: "The story presented in the French opera, by Camille Saint-Saëns, is about an artist ""whose life is dictated by love of drugs and Japan."" As a result, actors smoke marijuana on stage, and the theater itself encourages the audience to join them."
ref: "The story presented in the French opera, by Camille Saint-Saens, is of an artist ""whose life is dictated by a love for drugs and Japan."" As a result, the performers smoke cannabis joints on stage, and the theatre itself is encouraging the audience to join in."

src: "Leonov, também conhecido como ""cosmonauta No. 11"", foi parte da equipe original de cosmonautas da União Soviética. Em 18 de março de 1965, ele realizou a primeira atividade extraveicular tripulada (EVA), ou ""caminhada no espaço"", permanecendo sozinho fora da espaçonave por pouco mais de doze minutos. Ele recebeu o ""Herói da União Soviética"", o maior título honorário da União Soviética, por seu trabalho. Dez anos depois, ele liderou a parte soviética da missão de Apollo-Soyuz simbolizando que a Corrida Espacial havia acabado."
mt: "Leonov, also known as ""Cosmonaut No. 11"", was part of the original Soviet cosmonaut team. On March 18, 1965, he performed the first manned extravehicular activity (EVA), or ""space walk"", remaining alone outside the spacecraft for more than twelve minutes. He received the ""Hero of the Soviet Union"", the highest honorific title of the Soviet Union, for his work. Ten years later, he led the Soviet part of the Apollo-Soyuz mission symbolizing that the Space Race had ended."
ref: "Leonov, also known as ""cosmonaut No. 11"", was part of the Soviet Union's original team of cosmonauts. On March 18, 1965, he performed the first manned extravehicular activity (EVA), or ""spacewalk"", remaining alone outside the spacecraft for just over twelve minutes. He received the ""Hero of the Soviet Union"", the Soviet Union's highest honor, for his work. Ten years later, he led the Soviet part of the Apollo–Soyuz mission symbolizing that the Space Race was over."

src: "Após o acidente, Gibson foi movido para um hospital, mas morreu pouco tempo depois. O motorista de caminhão, que tem 64 anos, não sofreu ferimentos no acidente. O próprio veículo foi tirado do local do acidente mais ou menos às 12h GMT do mesmo dia. ""Havia crianças esperando para atravessar a rua e todas estavam gritando e chorando"", disse uma testemunha que estava trabalhando numa garagem próxima ao local do acidente. Todos eles correram de volta do lugar onde o acidente havia ocorrido."
mt: "After the accident, Gibson was moved to a hospital, but died shortly afterwards. The truck driver, who is 64 years old, was not injured in the accident. The vehicle itself was removed from the accident site more or less at 12 GMT on the same day. ""There were children waiting to cross the street and all were screaming and crying"", said a witness who was working in a nearby garage. All of them ran back from the place where the accident had occurred."
ref: "After the accident occurred, Gibson was transported to a hospital but died shortly afterwards. The truck driver, who is aged 64, was not injured in the crash. The vehicle itself was taken away from the scene of the accident at approximately 1200 GMT on the same day. A person working in a garage near where the accident occurred said: ""There were children waiting to cross the road and they were all screaming and crying."" They all ran back from where the accident had happened."

src: O trabalho feito foi, em sua maior parte, teórico, mas o programa foi escrito para simular observações feitas pela galáxia de sagitário. O efeito que a equipe procurava seria causado pelas forças de maré entre a matéria escura da galáxia e da Via Láctea. Assim como a Lua exerce uma atração sobre a Terra, causando as marés, a Via Láctea exerce uma força sobre a galáxia de Sagitário. Os cientistas conseguiram concluir que a matéria escura afeta outras matérias escuras da mesma forma que a matéria normal. Esta teoria afirma que a maioria da matéria escura no entorno de uma galáxia está localizada no entorno de uma galáxia em uma espécie de auréola e é composta de diversas partículas minúsculas.
mt: The work done was, for the most part, theoretical, but the program was written to simulate observations made by the Sagittarius galaxy. The effect that the team was looking for was caused by the tides between the dark matter of the galaxy and the Milky Way. Just as the Moon exerts a pull on the Earth, causing the tides, the Milky Way exerts a force on the Sagittarius galaxy. The scientists were able to conclude that dark matter affects other dark matters in the same way as normal matter. This theory states that most of the dark matter in the vicinity of a galaxy is located in the vicinity of a galaxy in a kind of halo and is composed of various tiny particles.
ref: The work done was mostly theoretical, but the program was written to simulate observations made of the Sagittarius galaxy. The effect the team was looking for would be caused by tidal forces between the galaxy's dark matter and the Milky Way's dark matter. Just like the moon exerts a pull on the earth, causing tides, so does the Milky Way exert a force on the Sagittarius galaxy. The scientists were able to conclude that the dark matter affect other dark matter in the same way regular matter does. This theory says that most dark matter around a galaxy is located around a galaxy in a kind of halo, and is made of lots of small particles.

src: "O debate começou com uma controvérsia sobre gastos com socorro e reconstrução após o Furacão Katrina, o que alguns conservadores fiscais rotularam humoristicamente de ""O acordo de Bush para Nova Orleans"". A crítica liberal sobre o esforço de reconstrução focou na concessão de contratos de reconstrução a pessoas com influência em Washington."
mt: "The debate began with a controversy over spending on relief and reconstruction after Hurricane Katrina, which some fiscal conservatives humorously labeled "The Bush deal for New Orleans." Liberal criticism of the reconstruction effort focused on the awarding of reconstruction contracts to people with influence in Washington."
ref: "The debate was sparked by controversy over spending on relief and reconstruction in the wake Hurricane Katrina; which some fiscal conservatives have humorously labeled ""Bush's New Orleans Deal."" Liberal criticism of the reconstruction effort has focused on the awarding of reconstruction contracts to perceived Washington insiders."

src: Quando a cápsula chegar à Terra e entrar na atmosfera, por volta das 5 horas da manhã (horário do leste), espera-se que seja um show de luzes para as pessoas no norte da Califórnia, Oregon, Nevada e Utah. A cápsula irá parecer bastante com uma estrela cadente passando pelo céu. A cápsula viajará a cerca de 12,8 km ou 8 milhas por segundo, rápida o suficiente para ir de São Francisco a Los Angeles em apenas um minuto. Stardust vai bater o recorde de todos os tempos como a nave espacial a voltar mais rápido para a Terra. O recorde anterior foi do retorno do Módulo de Comando da Apollo X, em maio de 1969. “Ele vai se mover pela costa oeste do norte da Califórnia e iluminar o céu do estado através do centro de Oregon e de Nevada e Idaho, e também em Utah”, afirmou Tom Duxbury, gerente de projeto da Stardust.
mt: When the capsule arrives on Earth and enters the atmosphere, around 5 a.m. (Eastern time), it is expected to be a light show for people in Northern California, Oregon, Nevada and Utah. The capsule will look quite like a shooting star passing through the sky. The capsule will travel at about 12.8 kilometers or 8 miles per second, fast enough to go from San Francisco to Los Angeles in just one minute. Stardust will set the record for all time as the fastest spacecraft to return to Earth. The previous record was from the return of the Apollo X Command Module, in May 1969. "It will move along the West Coast of Northern California and illuminate the sky of the state through the center of Oregon and Nevada and Idaho, and also in Utah," said Tom Duxbury, project manager of Stardust.
ref: When the capsule gets to Earth and enters the atmosphere, at about 5am (eastern time), it is expected to put on quite a light show for folks in Northern California, Oregon, Nevada, and Utah. The capsule will look much like a shooting star going across the sky. The capsule will be traveling at about 12.8 km or 8 miles per second, fast enough to go from San Francisco to Los Angeles in one minute. Stardust will set a new all-time record for being the fastest spacecraft to return to Earth, breaking the previous record set in May of 1969 during the return of the Apollo X command module. “It will move over the west coast of northern California and will light the sky from California through central Oregon and on through Nevada and Idaho and into Utah,” Tom Duxbury, Stardust's project manager said.
